"Camp courses include Forensic Crime Lab, DNA Science, Genome Science, DNA" "Barcoding, Biocoding, and more.” There is an on-site Open House on May 29th!" description: "“The New York City Center Externship Program introduces students and young adults" "to the many career options available to them in the arts, focusing on creative," "technical, design, and administrative arts jobs. Utilizing breaks in the NYC public" "school year, each session is centered around in-depth, experiential seminars. title: "New: Naval Horizons Essay Contest"
description: "“This contest challenges students to picture themselves in a STEM career by" "designing the U.S. Navy and Marine Corps of the future. Watch the videos to learn" "about U.S. Navy and Marine Corps STEM research areas and our people. Choose one" "of the STEM topics highlighted in the videos, conduct additional research on the" "subject, and compose your essay. Your essay needs to include 1) STEM Research" "Area, 2) Our People, and 3) The Future. The essays must be between 500-1,500 words" "total. All winners are eligible to receive a $200 cash prize.”" "Application Deadline: June 16 (11:59 PM)"

title: " New: Breakthrough Junior Challenge Video Contest"
description: "“You’ve grasped an important scientific theory, concept or principle. Now can you" "share your insight? An inventive video can get across complex material that would" "take pages of text to communicate. To take part in the Breakthrough Junior Challenge," "create a short video (two minute maximum) to explain a big idea in one of these" "fields: physics, mathematics, or life sciences. The top prize is a $250,000" "scholarship!”" "Application Deadline: September 15" "Links: https://breakthroughjuniorchallenge.org/challenge" "https://breakthroughjuniorchallenge.org/enter"

description: "SUNY Stonybrook is offering one-week creative & script-writing workshops for high" "school students on Zoom in July and August. The YAWP Summer Workshops will" "pair seasoned adult writers with students for workshops in fiction, personal narrative," "poetry, playwriting and screenwriting." Participants can invite friends and family to" "watch the film and all participants will receive a certificate on completion for" "completing the film.”" "REGISTRATION REQUIREMENTS" "Spots open every Monday at 11:00am." "   You must use the registration link on the TAP website in order to sign up" "each week." "   Registering today does not secure your spot for the remaining groups. You" "must register each week in order to attend each group." "   Spots are limited. If a group sells out, you are welcome to register the" "following week." "Dates: Fridays until June 20 (at 291 Broadway)" "Locations: 291 Broadway and 530 West 133 Street, Manhattan" " Application Deadline: Rolling Basis – First come, first served – limited spots" "Links: https://events.humanitix.com/tap-animated-storytelling-group" "https://www.theanimationproject.org/animated-storytelling-groups" "Deadline Approaching: Sound Thinking NYC" "“Sound Thinking NYC is a free program aimed at empowering young people" "interested in turning their passion for music into a profession. This program focuses" "on exploring careers in the music industry. There will be many opportunities to" "participate in music production and visit venues and sound production studios." "Students will be provided with free, healthy lunches and Metrocards. Program" "graduates will also be offered opportunities to apply for paid internships in the music" "industry in the Summer of 2026." "Dates: July 7 – August 15" "Application Deadline: May 25" "Program Start Date Approaching: Summer Editing Apprenticeship (SEA)" "“Over the five weeks of the apprenticeship students will gain advanced knowledge of" "the craft and art of literary editing and be prepared for senior editing roles at" "Polyphony Lit or their high school literary magazine. Through this course, students" "will connect with a global community of peer writers and readers. We believe that" "editing offers students an opportunity to develop and celebrate their unique voices in a" "way that is both fun and rewarding!”" "Dates: May 25 – June 29 OR July 13 – August 17" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Deadline Approaching: Ghetto Film School" "“The Ghetto Film School in the Bronx invites all students with an interest in" "filmmaking to apply for their free, 30-month Fellows program, which introduces" "students to professional-level film production and industry workshops. The Fellows" "Program is an intensive and challenging program requiring an exceptionally high" "levels of commitment. In addition to the 30- month class schedule, students and" "instructors oftentimes spend weekends and evenings at Ghetto Film School when" "necessary.”" "Dates: July 2025 – February 2027" "Application Deadline: May 26" "w6ynMC_jIeJeBTnRfFW2h5qSaLHU-nzAXIxCFW8htQ/viewform" "Deadline Approaching: The 92nd Street Y Young Writers’ Workshop" "“Develop your form and craft through analysis and creative prompts. Talk deeply and" "critically about your own work. Give smart and useful feedback on exercises and" " assignments. You’ll leave with a better understanding of your interests and goals as a" "writer, an understanding of what it takes to make a career in the literary community," "and a highly-developed body of new work.”" "Dates: July 14 – 24 (workshop for ages 12 – 14) or July 14 – 31 (workshop for ages" "(scholarships available)" "Application Deadline: May 30" "writers-workshop/young-writers-workshop-application" "Deadline Approaching: Irene Adler Essay Contest" "“The Irene Adler Prize offers a $1,000 US scholarship to a woman pursuing a degree" "in journalism, creative writing, or literature at a recognized postsecondary institution" "in the U.S., based on an essay competition.”" "or literature" "Application Deadline: May 30" "Deadline Approaching: A Voice for Animals Contest" "The 35th Annual Contest is open to all students 14-18 interested in promoting the" "humane treatment of animals and accepts video, photograph, and essay submissions" "on the topic. The top prize is $500, and a total of $5,900 will be awarded to winners." "Application Deadline: May 31" "Deadline Approaching: Summer Shakespeare Theater Program" "“Summer Shakespeare is a five-week summer intensive that is free for qualifying" "students. Twenty-two students are selected to train five days a week in voice," "movement, ensemble work, and scene study (50 hours of classes total). The program" "culminates in a production of an abbreviated Shakespeare play. Summer Shakespeare" "is an intensive program that requires the quick understanding and execution of new" "skills through master classes, play rehearsals, and the final performances.”" "Dates: July 7 - August 8" "Application Deadline: June 1" "Q5PtC05XsCwwKc8ieVq1wh_Q-KQtQFEvfHXiOkKm5ypSVA/viewform" "Deadline Approaching: New York Theater Workshop Mind the Gap" "“The goals of the program are both to teach writing and theatre skills and foster better" "communication and understanding between these two age groups: Adolescents &" "Seniors. Through the workshop participants are able to: INVESTIGATE, LISTEN and" "EMPATHIZE with someone of another generation, while using playwriting as a tool" "to understand and represent their unique experience, BROADEN THEIR" "PERSPECTIVE, see the other generation in a new light, and take on the task of telling" " someone else’s story with respect and understanding, SHARE THEIR STORIES and" "ultimately see them interpreted through another’s eyes making meaning out of their" "personal narratives and gaining insights into their own lives.”" "Dates: July 8 – August 12" "Application Deadline: June 2 (5:00 pm)" "Links: https://www.nytw.org/education/mind-the-gap/" "https://airtable.com/appwtDbCt3hUmJOLB/shrxHkqi0twdqhIkg" "Deadline Approaching: Jane Austen Society of North America (JASTA) Essay" "“The 2025 Essay Contest topic is about choosing something Austen has used in her" "novels—a particular word, a recurring situation or motif, perhaps a physical object," "symbol or activity—and then choose two scenes (they may be from the same novel or" "different ones) where she employs the chosen “something” in contrasting or" "complementary ways. Explain the different roles it plays and why Austen uses them as" "she does. What point is she trying to make? Does she succeed? In conclusion, explain" "what prompted your choice. "All participants earn minimum wage equivalent stipends for their participation. The goal is to" "increase the number of historically underrepresented and economically disadvantaged" "students prepared to enter college, and improve their participation rate in mathematics," "science, technology, health-related fields, and the licensed professions" "The program invites eligible students to participate in workshops and enrichment" "courses in math, science, SAT, and college preparatory workshops. All eligible" "students may apply, with different application deadlines for each campus.”" "1. ‘STEP’ Summer STEM Program at NYU Grossman School of Medicine" "“The Science and Technology Entry Program (STEP) provides students from 7th" "through 12th grade with enrichment classes, financial aid workshops, health" "professions training, social justice education, and mentorship. title: "New: Student Historian Internship 2025-2026 Program"
description: "“Student Historian interns are high school students who use the resources of the New" "York Historical Society to conduct exciting research and share their scholarship" "through creative digital projects. Interns meet with professional staff to learn about" "careers in the museum, library, and history fields; work collaboratively with fellow" "students to develop their public speaking and leadership skills; and engage in hands-" "on work to deepen their understanding of American history. The theme of this year’s" "internship is “Our Composite Nation: Frederick Douglass’ America” Upon" "completion, participants receive a $700 stipend." "Dates: October 29 – June 24, 2026 (Wednesdays after school)" "Application Deadline: August 24" "Priority Deadline Approaching:" "Apex for Youth’s Virtual Mentorship Program" "“The National Virtual Mentorship Program (NVMP) pairs Asian American high" "school students — particularly those from immigrant or low-income backgrounds —" "with caring, vetted mentors for long-term, 1:1 guidance." "Through virtual mentorship, students receive guidance on academics, college and" "career planning, and navigating the unique challenges of growing up Asian American." "NVMP is especially designed for youth who don’t have access to Apex for Youth’s" "in-person programs, creating a safe, empowering space no matter where they live.”" "What students get:" " 1:1   mentorship for at least 2 years" " Monthly    Zoom workshops with peers nationwide" " Up    to $40K in scholarships" " Career   & college readiness support" "A   free summer retreat in NYC" "backgrounds" "Dates: 2025 - 2026 School Year" "Priority Application Deadline: May 31" " Deadline Approaching: Sino-US Bridge Month in China Program" "The Sino-U.S. Bridge Program (SUBP) is dedicated to bridging the knowledge gap" "between American students and modern China. Our mission is to enhance future" "leaders’ competitiveness, empower students by exposing them to excellence" "worldwide, overcome barriers, and motivate students to transcend language, cost, and" "political obstacles when considering studying in China. Students will travel across" "China in cities such as: Beijing, the capital, Shanghai, the financial center, Hangzhou," "the e-commerce capital, and Shenzhen, the Silicon Valley of China, to explore top" "universities and technology companies and gain insights into China’s significant" "advancements in key fields. “The Only Known 30-Day Immersive Program in China’s" "Top Universities, Industries, and Cities - Transformational. Affordable." "Proven.” Have questions? Join our WeChat group (add by WechatID: NYRA19) to" "chat directly with SUBP 2024 alumni and parents." title: "New: Hack Club Athena Award"
description: "“Hack Club wants you to make things. Cool engineering things. Things you love to" "make. If you code and deploy three technical projects and spend 30 hours of coding by" "Oct 31st, Hack Club will issue you the Athena Award certification." "This is an exclusive badge for your website/LinkedIn/GitHub that is recognized by" "colleges like MIT and employers like SpaceX." "You will also instantly qualify to join Hack Club's NYC hackathon - the nation's" "largest all-girl hackathon - running from November 14th-November 16th. 250 girls" "can attend this 36 hour event, and we'll issue nearly 100 travel stipends.”" "Application Deadline: October 31"

title: "New: First Session Approaching:"
description: "Inspirit AI Scholars Sessions – Summer Courses" "“AI Scholars Live Online is a 10-session (25-hour) program that exposes high school" "students to fundamental AI concepts and guides them to build a socially impactful" "project. title: "New: Cosmetic Science and Formulation Design Summer Camp"
description: "“Did you know that The University of Toledo College of Pharmacy and" "Pharmaceutical Sciences has the nation’s only bachelor’s degree program in cosmetic" "science and formulation design? If you're interested in learning about the process of" "creating makeup and personal care products, join us for our second annual Virtual" "Cosmetic Science and Formulation Design Summer Camp. Participants will receive a" "camp kit including a t-shirt, DIY activities, games, and more! Challenges will be" "incorporated throughout the live camp and give attendees the opportunity to win" "Dates: June 24 – 27" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Program Dates Approaching:" "Updated: Rosetta Institute of Biomedical Research Workshops" "“The Rosetta Institute of Biomedical Research is entirely focused on creating highly" "regarded workshops for high-achieving high school students. Our instructors are PhD-" "level scientists who are actively engaged in medical research, and they expose" "students to cutting-edge molecular biology through engaging lectures, real-world labs," "and independent projects. Our in-person workshops at various universities include AI-" "enhanced bioinformatics, Molecular Neuroscience, Bioinformatics of Cancer," "Molecular Biology of Cancer, Molecular Immunology, Molecular Biology of Aging," "Astrobiology, Neurological Bioinformatics, and Biomedical Research. Our online" "workshops are separate concurrent sessions of Medicinal Chemistry, Medical" "Bioinformatics, and Introduction to Cellular and Molecular Medicine.”" "Dates: Various (June - August 2025)" "College London, OR Virtual" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis (Limited Spots)" "Links: https://www.rosettainstitute.org/" "https://www.rosettainstitute.org/biomedical-summer-camps/applyfinances/" "For a list of several Biomedical & Life Sciences opportunities, check this link:" "https://docs.google.com/document/d/1v9qPOmZ6djyM1jAfwIv-DBIEnR61RB2R/edit" " Deadline Approaching: Tribeca Pediatrics Summer Internship" "“Tribeca Pediatrics Summer Internship is an unpaid, 20-hour, week-long program that" "gives young adults the opportunity to see what it is like to be in the pediatric field by" "combining elements of workshops and shadowing into an awesome learning" "experience. In these weekly sessions, the goal will be to answer questions and shine a" "spotlight on key areas of pursuing a career in healthcare with a focus on children's" "health. After successfully finishing the 20 hour program, students will receive a" "Certificate of Completion.”" "Dates: July 14 – 18 (Session I) or August 18 – 22 (Session II)" "Application Deadline: June 1" "Links: https://www.tribecapediatrics.com/about-us/community-giving/" "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScyakLd3xUW2hJwabtH-" "a_zwVBliD471_ZQgeb2btrUpV627A/viewform" "Deadline Approaching: Bronx Health Prospects 2025-2026 Medical Program" "“BxHP is a free developmental online high school program focused on educating and" "empowering students interested in pursuing a career in healthcare." "The BxHP team consists of student leaders from the acclaimed Bronx Community" "Health Leaders (BxCHL) program. Our mission is to encourage and educate" "underrepresented high school students interested in healthcare. We are excited to" "invite high school students from all grades who are passionate about exploring the" "healthcare field to join our program for the 2025-2026 academic year.”" " Dates: 2025-2026 school year" "Application Deadline: June 6" "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScKeml7blepTXLiFYJdlzRqkN9k4FmKiqOnwTXbf" "03tgr0T3g/viewform" "International Young Researchers’ Conference Medical Humanities and Public" "Health Summer Programs" "“This program hosted by the Columbia University Vagelos College of Physician and" "Surgeons (VP&S) is a 3-week summer program that meets on Sundays from 8/3 –" "Dates: August 3- August 21(Sundays)" "Application Deadline: July 1" "Links: https://www.the-iyrc.org/medicalhumanities.html" "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdkq2NZbbo0vWh2TbGo3frQEQFSxibmvCyXdSwxK" "XCuQTjB9g/viewform" "Margaret Tietz Rehabilitation & Nursing Center Volunteers" "“The Margaret Tietz Nursing & Rehabilitation Center in Queens offers high school" "students the opportunity to work as summer volunteers in a residential/medical setting" "this summer. There will be a variety of in-person helping opportunities, with weekday" "& weekend spots available. To learn more, contact the Center at 718-298-7840." description: "The School of The New York Times: Summer Academy N.Y.C." "“Summer Academy N.Y.C. at The School of The New York Times is designed for" "curious-minded high school students interested in learning how to think critically and" "creatively about the world. Students explore a range of subjects including journalism," "business, politics and the arts alongside New York Times journalists and other" "industry thought leaders. Learn more about our two-week programs available this June" "and July in New York City.”" "Dates: Term 1: June 8 - 20, Term 2: June 22 - July 4, Term 3: July 6 - 18, Term 4:" "July 20 - August 1" "Locations: TBA (Manhattan)" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Links: https://nytedu.com/pre-college/summer-academy/" "https://nytedu.com/faq/nyc-summer-academy/"

title: "New: Event Approaching: Let Me Finish! Girls Write Now Voices of Comedy"
description: "“Join us for Girls Write Now’s very first stand-up comedy showcase—an afternoon of" "laughs, empowerment, and celebration! Come enjoy an event filled with big laughs," "bold stories, and plenty of heart, as mentees take the mic for their stand-up comedy" "debut. After the show, stick around to mingle and celebrate! Hosted by GWN teaching" "artist and Stand Up! Girls board member Hollie Harper, the evening will also feature" "performances by NYC-based female stand-up comedians. Let’s honor these young" "voices as they use comedy to challenge the status quo—one punchline at a time.”" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Updated: Deadline/Extended/Approaching:" "Octavia Project Summer Program: Science Fiction/Fantasy Workshops" "“Octavia Project Summer Institute is a free five-week-long program “for people who" "are into science fiction/fantasy and interested in workshops that combine art, writing," "science, and tech. Participants will create an online multimedia portfolio; strengthen" "skills in digital-media, art, and writing; and have access to a network of professional" "women and opportunities for fellowships and other leadership positions.”" "are 14 – 18 years old" "Dates: July 14 – August 14" "New Application Deadline: June 15" "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScYVi_1oQjF3U68PLlWyYSkuarFKTBrYxacd9ZuCB" "B94FMGiQ/viewform"

title: "New: Girls Write Now Salon Series - Writing the Places That Save Us"
description: " “Sometimes, the places we love are the spaces that allow us to create community." "Sometimes, the places we love are the spaces keeping us alive. Join Reese’s Book" "Club LitUp Fellow Arriel Vinson as she discusses her debut YA novel, Under the" "Neon Lights, and explores what it means to write the places that save us.”" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "DeadlineExtended/ Approaching:" "Octavia Project Summer Program: Science Fiction/Fantasy Workshops" "“The Octavia Project Summer Institute is a free five-week-long program for people" "who are into science fiction/fantasy and interested in workshops that combine art," "writing, science, and tech. Participants will create an online multimedia portfolio;" "strengthen skills in digital-media, art, and writing; and have access to a network of" "professional women and opportunities for fellowships and other leadership" "positions.”" "are 14 – 18 years old" "Dates: July – August, Mondays – Thursdays" "New Application Deadline: June 1 (or until all spots are taken)" " For a list of several Writing Opportunities, check this link:" "https://docs.google.com/document/d/1lT3cNpmmbC0qvOpjKgvN_GGK5RfutbNm/edit" "Updated: Events Today & Approaching:" "The Animation Project Animated Storytelling Series – Two Locations" "“The Animation Project (TAP) is providing free animation groups to youth in NYC" "ages 15-24. The group is run by a professional animator and creative Participants will" "collaborate and work on different aspects of the animation pipeline and at the end of" "the 12 weeks we will screen the film. Participants can invite friends and family to" "watch the film and all participants will receive a certificate on completion for" "completing the film.”" "REGISTRATION REQUIREMENTS" "Spots open every Monday at 11:00am." "   You must use the registration link on the TAP website in order to sign up" "each week." "   Registering today does not secure your spot for the remaining groups. You" "must register each week in order to attend each group." "   Spots are limited. If a group sells out, you are welcome to register the" "following week." "Dates: Fridays until June 20 (at 291 Broadway)" "Locations: 291 Broadway and 530 West 133 Street, Manhattan" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis – First come, first served – limited spots" "Links: https://events.humanitix.com/tap-animated-storytelling-group" "https://www.theanimationproject.org/animated-storytelling-groups" " Deadline Today: Behind the Curtain: Technical & Design Careers" "“The New York City Center Externship Program introduces students and young adults" "to the many career options available to them in the arts, focusing on creative," "technical, design, and administrative arts jobs. Utilizing breaks in the NYC public" "school year, each session is centered around in-depth, experiential seminars. Under the" "guidance of City Center staff and artists, participants will have opportunities to" "explore responsibilities and tasks for a variety of arts jobs and have a greater" "understanding of non-profit operations. Each program is free and includes daily lunch" "and complimentary tickets to a City Center production. Upon completion of each" "session, participants will leave with their creative project materials.”" "Application Deadline: May 30 (11:59 PM)" "Deadline Approaching: A Voice for Animals Contest" "The 35th Annual Contest is open to all students 14-18 interested in promoting the" "humane treatment of animals and accepts video, photograph, and essay submissions" "on the topic. The top prize is $500, and a total of $5,900 will be awarded to winners." "Application Deadline: May 31" "Deadline Approaching: Summer Shakespeare Theater Program" " “Summer Shakespeare is a five-week summer intensive that is free for qualifying" "students. Twenty-two students are selected to train five days a week in voice," "movement, ensemble work, and scene study (50 hours of classes total). The program" "culminates in a production of an abbreviated Shakespeare play. Summer Shakespeare" "is an intensive program that requires the quick understanding and execution of new" "skills through master classes, play rehearsals, and the final performances.”" "Dates: July 7 - August 8" "Application Deadline: June 1" "Q5PtC05XsCwwKc8ieVq1wh_Q-KQtQFEvfHXiOkKm5ypSVA/viewform" "Deadline Approaching: New York Theater Workshop Mind the Gap" "“The goals of the program are both to teach writing and theatre skills and foster better" "communication and understanding between these two age groups: Adolescents &" "Seniors. Through the workshop participants are able to: INVESTIGATE, LISTEN and" "EMPATHIZE with someone of another generation, while using playwriting as a tool" "to understand and represent their unique experience, BROADEN THEIR" "PERSPECTIVE, see the other generation in a new light, and take on the task of telling" "someone else’s story with respect and understanding, SHARE THEIR STORIES and" "ultimately see them interpreted through another’s eyes making meaning out of their" "personal narratives and gaining insights into their own lives.”" "Dates: July 8 – August 12" "Application Deadline: June 2 (5:00 pm)" "Links: https://www.nytw.org/education/mind-the-gap/" "https://airtable.com/appwtDbCt3hUmJOLB/shrxHkqi0twdqhIkg" "Deadline Approaching:" "Jane Austen Society of North America (JASTA) Essay Contest" "“The 2025 Essay Contest topic is about choosing something Austen has used in her" "novels—a particular word, a recurring situation or motif, perhaps a physical object," "symbol or activity—and then choose two scenes (they may be from the same novel or" "different ones) where she employs the chosen “something” in contrasting or" "complementary ways. Explain the different roles it plays and why Austen uses them as" "she does. What point is she trying to make? Does she succeed? In conclusion, explain" "what prompted your choice. The first place prize is a $1,000 scholarship, plus free" "registration and two nights’ lodging for JASNA’S 2025 Annual General Meeting.”" "Application Deadline: June 2" "Naval Horizons Essay Contest" "“This contest challenges students to picture themselves in a STEM career by" "designing the U.S. Navy and Marine Corps of the future. Watch the videos to learn" "about U.S. Navy and Marine Corps STEM research areas and our people. Choose one" "of the STEM topics highlighted in the videos, conduct additional research on the" "subject, and compose your essay. Your essay needs to include 1) STEM Research" " Area, 2) Our People, and 3) The Future. The essays must be between 500-1,500 words" "total. All winners are eligible to receive a $200 cash prize.”" "Application Deadline: June 16 (11:59 PM)" "Litchfield Jazz Camp" "“LJC is a non-competitive program focusing on musical and personal growth. No pre-" "audition is required. We listen to you when you arrive and assign you to a combo at" "your level. In a month-long program on the campus in Washington, Connecticut," "Litchfield Jazz Camp embraces all learners - students 13 years to adult, beginners," "intermediate and advanced players, students with learning disabilities, and others." "Each year Litchfield Performing Arts awards approximately 1/3 of their students" "need-based scholarships to Jazz Camp, thanks to additional funding made available" "through grants, foundations, and individual donors.”" "Dates: June 29 – July 25" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Links: https://litchfieldjazzcamp.com/camp-registration/" "https://litchfieldjazzcamp.com/camp-registration/tuition/" "Application Form: https://form.jotform.com/LitchfieldJazzCamp/ljc-registration-" "The Open Stage Project Act One & Act Two Behind the Scenes Production" " “Open Stage offers two free opportunities for female & non-binary students:" "Act One is a single 90-minute interactive panel led by entertainment professionals to" "learn about behind-the-scenes careers." "Act Two is a September – May afterschool program, which includes:" "o   Field trips to set, costume, and lighting shops" "o   Monthly skill-building workshops" "o   One-on-one mentoring with film and Broadway professionals" "o   Broadway shows plus Q&As with female crew members" "o   Capstone design presentation for a new play with a CreateHER playwright" "No prior tech or backstage experience is required." "Act Two: 10th, 11th, and 12th grade female & non-binary students" "Dates: Various for Act One; Act Two - from September – May" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Links: https://www.openstageproject.org/program" "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSekhb7ok46_gk7KpCJ7Ujv3J36ChrDSlDj2JCVHzfy2u" "mTWXQ/viewform" "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeEThI4dUIspfC6c8cI4R0I00iWLzm9DSHMzN5sEc0i" "jUgpEQ/viewform" "Filmmaking at Hooks Art Media" "“Accepted applicants will learn how to use DSLR cameras and the professional sound" "and lighting equipment used on sets all around the world. Students learn camera" "operation, sound recording, use of lighting equipment, video editing software and" "produce short documentary videos on topics of relevance to themselves and their" "communities." " All participants earn minimum wage equivalent stipends for their participation. The" "program concludes with a public screening of students’ films for families and" "friends.”" "Dates: July 1 - July 31 (Mondays - Thursdays, 10AM-4PM)" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Uptown Stories Summer Writing Workshops" "“Come write the world with US! No matter which class you choose, you’ll become a" "better writer and communicator, and you’ll hold your head a little higher knowing" "you’re a published author. This is your space, where your voice will be heard, and" "you’ll be surrounded by supportive teachers and peers. If you haven’t experienced an" "Uptown Stories workshop yet, this is the perfect time to give it a try. Workshops" "include: Advanced Fiction, Anime: IKŌ!, and Scoop, There It Is!”" "Dates: Various sessions in July and August" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Links: https://www.uptownstories.org/workshops" "Neighborhood Playhouse Junior Acting School" "“Modeled after the adult conservatory, the Junior School trains all its students in the" "core principles of acting, applying techniques and skills learned to various classes in" " singing, movement/dance, scene study, monologues, voice & diction, stage combat," "Shakespeare, acting for film & television, commercials, voice overs, auditioning," "improvisation and more--giving students complete actor training and the skills needed" "to be creative and competitive in their craft and in life.”" "Dates: Summer 2025" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Links: https://neighborhoodplayhouse.org/apply/playhouse-juniors/summer-program" "https://www.neighborhoodplayhouse.org/admissions" "Write the World Virtual Summer Writing Camps 2025" "“Jump into new genres of writing, connect with campers across the globe, and learn" "from notable authors, editors, and educators in Write the World’s Virtual Writing" "Camp. During camp, you’ll engage in interactive writing activities, connect with peers" "around the world, and work together to grow your writing skills. After camp, you’ll" "work independently (and asynchronously) on writing prompts and activities, guided" "by peer and expert review, at your own pace, for a total time commitment of about" "three to four hours per day.”" "Dates: Various in Summer 2025" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" " STEM from Dance: Girls Rise Up" "“Girls Rise Up is our three-week summer program designed for girls to explore the" "exciting world of STEM. Each day is jampacked with dance to get participants" "moving and to supercharge their STEM skills. By the end of the program, participants" "will showcase what they’ve learned in a performance that merges dance and" "technology – all created by them and their fellow participants. Girls Rise Up is an" "opportunity for girls of all backgrounds to level up their confidence, unlock new" "STEM abilities, and connect with a supportive tribe of like-minded creatives and" "technologists.”" "Dates: July 14 – August 1(9AM - 3PM, Monday - Friday)" "Locations: NYU (6 MetroTech Center, Brooklyn, NY ) or Barnard College (3009" "Broadway, Manhattan)" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "IRT Theater Summer Theater Program" "This innovative off-Broadway theater company welcomes students (no experience" "necessary) to join “A Westside Experiment,” their teen theater program. Participants" "will develop skills to create original devised theater in collaboration with a working" "theater company in residence at IRT." "Dates: August 11 – 23" "Application Deadline: August 11" "https://www.eventbrite.com/e/a-westside-experiment-young-actors-laboratory-summer-2025-tickets-" "1063525376029?aff=oddtdtcreator" "Theater Development Fund’s Graduation Gift" "“TDF has a special gift to all graduating seniors from NYC’s public and charter high" "schools, a FREE one-year membership to our discount ticket program for Broadway," "Off-Broadway, Off-Off Broadway music and dance! Congratulations! Explain the different roles it plays and why Austen uses them as she does. What" " point is she trying to make? Does she succeed? In conclusion, explain what prompted" "your choice. The first place prize is a $1,000 scholarship, plus free registration and" "two nights’ lodging for JASNA’S 2025 Annual General Meeting.”" "Application Deadline: June 2" "Deadline Approaching: The Stuck at the Prom Contest" "This challenges students to create prom attire out of Duck Brand duct tape. title: "New: Final Education PSA Scholarship"
description: "“This year, we are inaugurating our first Financial Education PSA Scholarship to" "current and incoming undergraduate and graduate students. The goal is to provide" "students with an outlet to educate their fellows in an area of financial literacy that" "interests them. You will write a public service announcement (PSA) addressed to your" "peers. Choose a topic related to financial literacy and craft a persuasive and" "informative PSA according to the guidelines below. The winning submission, selected" "by our scholarship selection committee, will receive $1,500.”" "Application Deadline: September 15" "Deadline Approaching: Bank of Hope - Hope Scholarship Foundation" "“As one of the leading Asian American Banks, we strive to be good neighbors and" "support our customers and communities in any way we can. To date, we have" "distributed more than $2 million in scholarships through the Hope Scholarship" "Foundation. This is a great opportunity for (2025 high school graduate)/college" "freshmen at a 4-year or 2-year institution in financial need who have demonstrated" " strong academic performance and leadership capabilities. To be considered, applicants" "will have the opportunity to submit 500 words on a selected essay topic and show us" "why they are deserving of the $2,500 award.”" "Application Deadline: June 6 (5 pm)" "Deadline Approaching: Pasta Rose Scholarship" "“The Pasta Rose Scholarship is a yearly scholarship awarded to Brooklyn high school" "students who have lost a parent to cancer. Having the strength and resilience to go on" "after losing a parent at a young age is no easy task. This scholarship will help those" "kids who have lost so much... help them to go to college, to succeed, and to help them" "feel just a little bit better.”" "Application Deadline: June 10" "Deadline Approaching: Angel Wings U.S. Thai Scholarship" "“The Angels Wings Foundation announces our ninth round of Thai Scholarships for" "rising college students of Thai ancestry residing in the United States. The initiative" "behind the Angels Wings Thai Scholarship is to recognize and honor Thai American" "students who have demonstrated academic excellence, concern for their Thai" "community, heritage connection and desire to continue their education. The required" "factors may be demonstrated through participation in community, high school/college" "and advocacy activities.”" " Application Deadline: June 13" "Links: https://www.angelswingsfoundation.org/application" "https://www.angelswingsfoundation.org/angels-wings-thai-us-scholarship-2025" "Deadline Approaching: Transportation YOU High School Scholarship" "“To assist women pursuing education and professional careers in transportation-" "related fields, the Greater New York Chapter of WTS invites eligible women to apply" "for the scholarships. The Transportation YOU High School Scholarship for $1,500 is" "awarded to an outstanding high school junior or senior interested in undertaking" "careers in transportation and studying math, science, engineering or technology.”" "transportation-related field with a minimum 3.0 GPA (Male students may still apply)" "Application Deadline: June 13 (11:59 PM)" "Study.com Student Scholarships" "“In order to push toward our goal of making education accessible, Study.com has" "designated a wide variety of academic awards and scholarships for students." "Study.com is thrilled to be awarding over $50,000 in scholarships. These academic" "awards are geared toward people with ranging backgrounds, identities, and academic" "goals. Check out our list below to apply for any scholarships you may qualify for!”" "Application Deadline: June 30" "Bryan Cameron Impact Scholarships" " These undergraduate scholarships are four-year, full-tuition, impact-driven and are" "awarded annually to 10-15 exceptional high school students who have demonstrated" "excellence in leadership, community service, extracurricular activities and" "academics." "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis (until 3,000 complete applications are received)" "Bold.org Scholarship Resource" "“Bold.org is the largest independent scholarship provider in the U.S. with millions of" "college students funded. In addition to the traditional array of scholarships, they" "recently announced a wide variety of scholarships for immigrant students.”" "Application Deadlines: Various" "scholarships/" "The Ultimate Scholarship Spreadsheet Resource" "“Our spreadsheet houses an extensive array of scholarships, complete with filters to" "help students quickly identify the opportunities that best suit their needs. Updated" "weekly, it highlights the top ten scholarships of the month, ensuring you never miss" "out on lucrative funding options.”" "Links: https://www.seedsoffortune.org/post/the-ultimate-scholarship-spreadsheet-" "your-one-stop-guide-to-securing-free-money-for-college" "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12UUO-Om8HtAFJ8bE-" "aQo1ZNBSixsHLinhvCyfn94CbQ/edit?gid=0#gid=0" " Reserve Officers Training Corps (ROTC)" "The various military services offer Reserve Officers Training Corps (ROTC) full-" "tuition scholarships to graduating seniors who attend any of more than 1,000" "participating colleges. Applicants must have a 3.0 GPA and specific SAT/ACT scores." "Learn more about the Air Force’s program at:" "https://www.afrotc.com/" "RETURN TO TOP" "Resume & cover letter templates for basic student resumes may be accessed at the" "following links:" "http://jobsearch.about.com/od/resumesandcoverletters/l/blhighschool2.htm" "http://jobsearch.about.com/od/resumetemplates/a/templatehs.htm" "Working Papers: Some jobs, internships, and programs do require students 14-17" "years old to obtain working papers (official name: employment certificates). The" "necessary application form may be obtained from Mr. Myles Sebastien (who can" "explain the procedure and answer any questions) in the Stuyvesant Guidance Office" "(Room 236) between 8:00am – 3:30pm." "If you are selected for or enroll in any of the above opportunities, please inform" " Mr. Blumm ASAP at: hblumm@stuy.edu" "Whichever extra-curricular program, internship, or community service activity a" "student may participate in, they should be sure to ask their supervisor/coordinator to" "write a letter of appreciation before it concludes – it is sometimes very difficult to" "obtain this later on. And the more personal & detailed the letter, the better. A copy" "should then be submitted to your counselor." "Please feel free to contact Harvey Blumm at hblumm@stuy.edu with any questions or" "feedback on any items in this message, or with any suggestions or concerns you may" "have. And always feel free to share any information about opportunities that may" "be of interest to our parents, teachers, or students."

Fordham University STEP Summer Program" "“The Fordham Science and Technology Entry Program (STEP) is an academic" "enrichment program designed to prepare underrepresented and economically" "disadvantaged junior high and high school students (grades 7-12) for college and" "careers in STEM fields (science, technology, engineering, and math) fields, health" "careers, and licensed professions, like accounting, law, psychology, social work" " among other licensed fields. You will receive the following services: academic" "enrichment for the math and science classes students, exposure to STEM-related," "health, and other licensed professions, mentoring and tutoring from Fordham" "undergraduate students, etc.”" "Identify as minority OR economically disadvantaged" "Dates: July 7th - July 31st, Monday-Thursday, locations have different times" "Application Deadline: June 9" "https://www.fordham.edu/academics/academic-resources/step/step-summer-program/" "2. "Dates: June - August" "Application Deadline: June 27" "Queensborough Community College – Robotics Summer Program" "“Looking for something exciting to do this summer while earning free college" "credits? Then the College Now Summer Robotics Program is for you! Students work" "in teams in person on the QCC Campus to design, construct and program autonomous" "mobile robots. Students will demonstrate what they have learned at a showcase on" "August 4th.”" "Dates: June 30 – August 4" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Links: https://www.qcc.cuny.edu/collegeNow/summer.html" "https://www.qcc.cuny.edu/collegeNow/docs/CN_Robotics_Summer_25.pdf" "https://www.qcc.cuny.edu/collegeNow/faqs.html" "College Passport at University Settlement: Intro to Calculus" "“The Intro to Calculus program aims to support students who either:" "a) do not feel challenged enough in schools;" "b) plan to study a Math-intensive major in colleges, such as science, engineering," "social-science-related majors (Psychology, Quantitative Sociology, Education" "Studies, etc.), or business-related majors (Finance, Accounting, Marketing," "Communication, etc.)" "c) hope to study in advance to better prepare for their calculus classes in future.”" "Dates: Tuesdays and Thursdays, July 10 - August 7" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "National History Academy Summer Program" "“Spend your summer at the National History Academy’s Residential Summer" "Program. title: "New:"
description: "The New York City Department of Housing Develoment & Preservation Summer" "Communications Internship" "“This summer, we’re looking for motivated, curious students to join our small but" "mighty Communications team at HPD — the city agency responsible for affordable" "housing. Our interns get to do meaningful work that supports real-world housing" "policy and programs, while also building a strong foundation in public service" "communications." "The internship is designed as a well-rounded experience that touches on all" "aspects of what we do — social media, press and storytelling, public engagement," "and event planning for senior leadership. Interns gain hands-on experience drafting" "content, helping shape communications strategies, supporting public events, and" "contributing to the narrative around how the City is tackling its housing challenges." "Interns will walk away with:" " tangible portfolio work and writing samples" " access to professional development resources" " networking opportunities with senior staff across the agency and city" "government" " a deeper understanding of how large public institutions work — and how to" "navigate them" "We’re especially excited to hear from students who are passionate about public" "service, housing equity, or storytelling that makes a difference. Urban studies," " journalism, communications, policy — all great backgrounds, but we’re open to" "anyone with strong writing skills, attention to detail, and a willingness to jump in.”" "Dates: Various" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "https://drive.google.com/file/d/1pMSli7tUt5fMxjLJQbQsOHGEbwng4fzL/view?usp=sharing"

title: "New: Keith Power for Manhattan Borough President Fellowship Program"
description: "“This program is dedicated to giving young people a voice in political campaigns by" "directly reaching out to voters from Inwood to Battery Park City, while giving you a" "front-row seat to this intense political battle. Fellows will engage in direct voter" "contact including canvassing, phone banking, and visibility efforts to reach out to" "voters in the district, communicate, and advocate for Keith’s platform, issues, and" "policies. Living in Manhattan is not required.”" "Dates: Until June 24" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfMt2AKH7gkMWdU-" "PSaajsHJDFWNRoWgBQzoZ2FTMVEewy4eQ/viewform"

title: "New: Alvin Bragg for Manhattan District Attorney Campaign Internship"
description: "“Alvin Bragg’s re-election campaign for Manhattan District Attorney is seeking" "passionate and committed interns to support our grassroots efforts. Interns will support" "Alvin Bragg’s re-election campaign through direct voter contact— canvassing, phone" "banking, voter registration, and event outreach." " A commitment of at least 5 hours per week is expected, with flexible scheduling and" "some remote options available. Interns will receive training, gain hands-on political" "experience, and build connections within NYC’s civic community. This internship" "runs through the June 2025 Democratic primary on June 24th and does not extend into" "the general election." "To apply, please email your résumé or a short statement of interest to" "quinn@alvinbragg.com with the subject line: ""[Your Name] – Alvin Bragg Campaign" "Internship Application.”" "Dates: Summer 2025" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis (until June 24)" "https://drive.google.com/file/d/1eZghtuqAVZvUItvFgp4j5WrUDXh30d_L/view?usp=sharing" "To learn about several other local political campaigns seeking high school" "volunteers, check this link:" "https://docs.google.com/document/d/1a8qzwZdcOLHjDFvkExwzgbIbLEYe0omd/edit" "Deadline Approaching:" "The National Security Language Virtual Initiative for Youth (NSLI-Y)" "“Virtual NSLI-Y, a program of the U.S. Department of State's Bureau of Educational" "and Cultural Affairs, provides U.S. high school students with beginner-level foreign" "language and culture experience. Eligible U.S. high school students can apply to" "Virtual NSLI-Y to study Arabic, Chinese (Mandarin), Hindi, Korean, Russian, or" "Turkish. Selected finalists will receive a merit scholarship to study the language and" "associated culture(s) in live, online classes with peers from across the U.S.!”" " Dates: September 8 – November 16" "Application Deadline: June 9 (4:00PM); recommendation due by June 12" "Links: https://www.nsliforyouth.org/virtual/" "https://www.nsliforyouth.org/virtual/virtual-nsli-y-application-timeline/" "Deadline Approaching: NYC Youth Food Advocates" "YFA is for young people who want to learn about social justice, public policy and" "advocacy, and are ready to create systemic change in New York City food systems," "with a focus on school food. YFA members complete a week-long summer leadership" "training, attend (virtual) weekly meetings during the school year and participate in 4" "in-person workshop days throughout the year. YFA members also receive a stipend of" "up to $550." "Dates: August 2025 – June 2026" "Application Deadline: June 15" "Links: https://www.foodadvocates.org/youth-leadership" "https://awatts164382.typeform.com/to/LYRqJzYW?typeform-source=www.foodadvocates.org" "Event Approaching: Create Your Personal Brand Workshops" "“Goodwill Virtual Career Center is a proactive learning program that offers free" "workshops to help you hit the ground running with your best foot forward on the path" "to success. Learn how to create and project a professional image of yourself, and" "strengthen your self-marketing and networking skills.”" "Dates: June 19, July 3, 17, 31 & more" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "111961616208?aff=ebdsoporgprofile" "Deadline Approaching: 2025 NYC HERricane Summer Session" "“HERricane is a national innovative program created to empower women to excel in" "Emergency Management and related fields. With women often underrepresented yet" "disproportionately affected by disasters, it's time to change the narrative. Participants" "will participate in a variety of activities focusing on emergency management and" "personal development including but not limited to: Interactive workshops, Emergency" "management simulations, Field trips, and Trainings to equip young women with" "lifelong skills.”" "Brooklyn)" "Application Deadline: June 20" "AAPI-LEAD Program (Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders- Learn. Engage." "Advocate. Dream)" " “AAPI-LEAD is a 4-day youth conference that brings together NYC’s AAPI and" "allied youth to discuss the experiences and issues most relevant to AAPI young" "people. AAPI-LEAD aims to develop AAPI youth's understanding of and relationship" "to their own identities, deepen the connections between social justice and equity in" "relation to systems and community, and equip youth with the tools to advocate for" "themselves, their families, and the wider AAPI community as a whole. Youth will also" "have the opportunity to apply to the Asian American Students Advocacy Project" "(ASAP), CACF's youth leadership program, by coming to this conference. ”" "Dates: June 27 - 30 or August 14 - 17" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "The Legal Empowerment Fellows Program at Defying Legal Gravity: 2025-2026" "“The Legal Empowerment Fellows Program is a paid, one-year fellowship in which" "high school students spend the academic school year obtaining a foundation in the" "law. The program is a zero-cost program- breakfast, lunch, and metro cards are" "provided.”" "Dates: Select Saturdays from September 2025 through June 2026 from 10:00 am -" "Locations: In-person at Fordham University School of Law near Columbus Circle" "Application Deadline: June 29" "https://www.defyinglegalgravity.org/apply?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email" "Future Teachers Program with Young Minds in Motion – For Seniors" "“Are you a high school senior interested in becoming a teacher? The Future Teachers" "Program offers a paid, hands-on experience in early childhood and elementary" "education. Students will work alongside certified educators, attend career" "development workshops, and receive mentorship to support their journey into the" "teaching profession. To start the application process, email your resume to Niyasha" "James at niyashaj@youngmindsinmotion.com ”" "Dates: Ongoing" "Application Deadline: July 1" "Student Historian Internship 2025-2026 Program" "“Student Historian interns are high school students who use the resources of the New" "York Historical Society to conduct exciting research and share their scholarship" "through creative digital projects. Interns meet with professional staff to learn about" "careers in the museum, library, and history fields; work collaboratively with fellow" "students to develop their public speaking and leadership skills; and engage in hands-" "on work to deepen their understanding of American history. The theme of this year’s" "internship is “Our Composite Nation: Frederick Douglass’ America” Upon" "completion, participants receive a $700 stipend." " Dates: October 29 – June 24, 2026 (Wednesdays after school)" "Application Deadline: August 24" "RETURN TO TOP" "Museums, Art, Photography:"

title: "New: The Putney School Summer Arts Program"
description: "“Join us to hear about this hilltop in Vermont where teens, artists, and writers gather" "each July to make art, write, and create community. title: "New: Drexel University Digital Development Camp"
description: "“The Drexel University Digital Development Camp is a three-week in-person summer" "program led by College of Computing & Informatics (CCI) faculty and student" "leaders. title: "New: Usdan Summer Camp Programs"
description: "“Usdan’s Classic Program provides an immersive arts experience and fosters" "friendship and shared enthusiasm among young artists in grades 2 through 12. "Like the musical notation for which it is named, Usdan’s Allegro Music Program is" "fun-filled and upbeat—a camp experience that expands students’ appreciation of" "music. For four or eight weeks, musicians and vocalists in our Allegro Music Program" "immerse themselves in music and nature on Usdan’s 140-acre campus.”" "Dates: Various" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Links: https://www.usdan.org/our-program/dates-and-rates" "https://www.usdan.org/summer-camp/programs/classic-program" "https://www.usdan.org/programs" "https://www.usdan.org/allegro-music-program" "Deadline Extended/ Approaching: Summer Shakespeare Theater Program" "“Summer Shakespeare is a five-week summer intensive that is free for qualifying" "students. The program" "culminates in a production of an abbreviated Shakespeare play. Summer Shakespeare" "is an intensive program that requires the quick understanding and execution of new" "skills through master classes, play rehearsals, and the final performances.”" "Dates: July 7 - August 8" "New Application Deadline: June 13" "Q5PtC05XsCwwKc8ieVq1wh_Q-KQtQFEvfHXiOkKm5ypSVA/viewform" "For a list of several Writing Opportunities, check this link:" " https://docs.google.com/document/d/12xABLyREvMsmbE4_mv7dnQ8BriPJzwlO/edit" "Program Dates Approaching:" "The School of The New York Times: Summer Academy N.Y.C." Students explore a range of subjects including journalism," "business, politics and the arts alongside New York Times journalists and other" "industry thought leaders. Learn more about our two-week programs available this June" "and July in New York City.”" "Dates: Term 1: June 8 - 20, Term 2: June 22 - July 4, Term 3: July 6 - 18, Term 4:" "July 20 - August 1" "Locations: TBA (Manhattan)" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Links: https://nytedu.com/pre-college/summer-academy/" "https://nytedu.com/faq/nyc-summer-academy/" "Event Approaching: Let Me Finish! Girls Write Now Voices of Comedy" "“Join us for Girls Write Now’s very first stand-up comedy showcase—an afternoon of" "laughs, empowerment, and celebration! Come enjoy an event filled with big laughs," "bold stories, and plenty of heart, as mentees take the mic for their stand-up comedy" "debut. After the show, stick around to mingle and celebrate! Hosted by GWN teaching" "artist and Stand Up! Girls board member Hollie Harper, the evening will also feature" "performances by NYC-based female stand-up comedians. Let’s honor these young" "voices as they use comedy to challenge the status quo—one punchline at a time.”" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Deadline Approaching:" "Octavia Project Summer Program: Science Fiction/Fantasy Workshops" "“Octavia Project Summer Institute is a free five-week-long program “for people who" "are into science fiction/fantasy and interested in workshops that combine art, writing," "science, and tech. Participants will create an online multimedia portfolio; strengthen" "skills in digital-media, art, and writing; and have access to a network of professional" "women and opportunities for fellowships and other leadership positions.”" "are 14 – 18 years old" "Dates: July 14 – August 14" "New Application Deadline: June 15" "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScYVi_1oQjF3U68PLlWyYSkuarFKTBrYxacd9ZuCB" "B94FMGiQ/viewform" "Deadline Approaching: Naval Horizons Essay Contest" " “This contest challenges students to picture themselves in a STEM career by" "designing the U.S. Navy and Marine Corps of the future. Your essay needs to include 1) STEM Research" "Area, 2) Our People, and 3) The Future. The essays must be between 500-1,500 words" "total. All winners are eligible to receive a $200 cash prize.”" "Application Deadline: June 16 (11:59 PM)" "RETURN TO TOP" " Opportunity Lists and Resources:" "Click on the link below for a list of helpful lists and guides to a wide variety of" "programs and other opportunities:" "https://docs.google.com/document/d/1507ozc-" "AbhTI6DlTRBTQWMpRHToNMRki/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=111212941873538043271&rtpof=true&sd=true" "RETURN TO TOP" "Scholarships:" "General List of Available Scholarships via Fastweb" "https://www.fastweb.com/college-scholarships/articles/scholarships-for-high-school-seniors" "Deadline Approaching: Pasta Rose Scholarship" "“The Pasta Rose Scholarship is a yearly scholarship awarded to Brooklyn high school" "students who have lost a parent to cancer. This scholarship will help those" "kids who have lost so much... help them to go to college, to succeed, and to help them" "feel just a little bit better.”" "Application Deadline: June 10" "Deadline Approaching: Angel Wings U.S. Thai Scholarship" " “The Angels Wings Foundation announces our ninth round of Thai Scholarships for" "rising college students of Thai ancestry residing in the United States. "If you are selected for or enroll in any of the above opportunities, please inform" "Mr. Blumm ASAP at: hblumm@stuy.edu" "Whichever extra-curricular program, internship, or community service activity a" "student may participate in, they should be sure to ask their supervisor/coordinator to" "write a letter of appreciation before it concludes – it is sometimes very difficult to" "obtain this later on. title: "New: Mapt Content Development Internship"
description: """We are actively seeking a group of 15-20 students for a three-week product" "management internship. The selected students admitted into the program will become" "Content Development Interns. This means they will collaborate with other lead" "student interns to create a milestone worth of in-app content for the Mapt College" "Planning mobile app. Interns will ultimately help Mapt’s product team to build a" "product people love to use.""" "Dates: July 14 – August 1 (2 or 3 times per week)" "Application Deadline: June 23 (11:59PM)" "KXVfUDwE5T0Q/viewform" "Deadline Approaching: Jane Street WISE Program" "“In this challenging multi-day program, we invite women, transgender, and gender-" "expansive people to learn how we use math, computer science, and probability" "concepts in trading. This program was created for people who are early in their" " undergraduate studies, including students about to start their first year of university." " Four biweekly rounds of competition include a new theme introduced each round." "Students can choose to participate in one or two rounds, or all four. NYPIRG is a nonpartisan, not-for-profit" "organization that advances important public interest issues through sophisticated" "grassroots organizing and advocacy, public education, and media exposure." "Our Community Outreach teams are building the grassroots movement to hold" "elected leaders accountable, end fossil fuel dependency, and bring climate polluters to" "justice! Staff will be paid $17.25 hourly and have health coverage and paid vacation" "benefits.”" "Dates: TBD" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Hofstra University PreCollegiate Career Discovery Program" " Hofstra University is offering various courses this summer. Build an entrepreneurial mindset and graduate with a business plan," "resume material, and the competitive edge to set you apart in anything you do.”" "Dates: 5 weeks starting July 7 or July 21" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Columbia CORE Youth Entrepreneurship Program for High Schoolers" "“Columbia's CORE Youth is a student-run initiative that seeks to empower students" "into the startup world. At the end of the semester, we will bring all participants to" "Columbia for a conference at which they can attend the Demo Day of CORE's" "accelerator, and present their projects. title: "New: Deadline Approaching:"
description: "Sparks Within Reach Summer BUILD Internship 2025" "“We are currently seeking high-school students to volunteer as part of our summer" "programs at P.S 188 (The Island School) and Barrier Free Living Housing Center." "Interns at each program will have the opportunity to make a real impact with housing-" "insecure students by helping to lead academic and enrichment programming and" "providing individualized support to students." "In addition, all Sparks interns will become trained in trauma-informed educational" "methods and have the opportunity to pursue an independent project at the end of the" "summer. In this project, interns will utilize what they have learned throughout the" "program to further address housing insecurity and education inequality in an" "innovative way.”" "Dates: July - August (various)" "the Bronx)" "Application Deadline: June 15 (11:59pm)" "Deadline Approaching: Brooklyn Public Library Teen Techies" "“Do you love technology and your library? Want to make a difference in your" "community? Looking to build your resume and gain valuable work and leadership" "experience? Apply to BPL's Teen Techies program! By participating, you'll learn new" "computer skills in a two-week summer technology institute, and then share those skills" "by helping patrons use library computers throughout the coming school year." "You'll also assist library staff with computer troubleshooting and computer training" "workshops for the public. You will receive stipends following successful completion" "of training and library service hours.”" "Dates: Summer (two-week training workshop) + 2026 School Year (minimum 3" "hours/week)" "Application Deadline: June 19" "Links: https://www.bklynlibrary.org/support/volunteer/teen-techies" "https://www.bklynlibrary.org/support/volunteer/t4/form" "Program Start Date Approaching: DOROT’s Summer Teen Internships" "“Help the Elderly Dorot” is a senior-services organization that runs 4-week summer" "internship programs for teens to assist elderly New Yorkers in three separate programs" "in Manhattan & Long Island. Over the course of the session, teen interns develop" " leadership skills and build intergenerational connections through a variety of" "activities." "Dates: June 23 – July 16 OR July 23 – August 14 OR July 28 – August 21 (Mondays" "– Thursdays from 10 am – 4:30 pm or 5:00 pm)" "Locations: DOROT 171 W 85th St, Manhattan OR at Suffolk Y JCC, 74 Hauppauge" "Rd, Commack, NY" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Links: https://www.dorotusa.org/volunteer/high-school-college-internships/summer-" "teen-internship-program" "https://www.dorotusa.org/dorot-summer-teen-internship-programs-faqs" "Events Approaching:" "Upcoming Museum of Mathematics Student Volunteer Opportunities" "“High school students volunteering at MoMath can accrue hours for their school's" "community service requirement.” MoMath is always looking for volunteers!" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Contact: email: volunteers@momath.org" "Hospital Volunteer Opportunities" "Most NYC hospitals welcome high school student helpers. Age requirements and time" "commitments vary, so contact locations of interest for more specific information." title: "New: Camp College"

title: "New: Deadline Approaching:"
description: "FHAA Teen Leadership Program: Youth Ambassadors" "“The Forest Hills Asian Association (FHAA), a community leader in advocacy," "cultural celebration, and civic engagement, is launching the FHAA Youth" "Ambassadors Program. This student-led initiative empowers local teens through" "leadership development, community service, career exploration, and cultural" " enrichment. title: "New: Rooted in the City Internship"
description: "“You’ll get your hands in the soil, learn to ID local plants and trees (yes, even the" "ones growing through sidewalk cracks), and discover how fungi, dirt, and weeds have" "medicinal purposes. Through different cultural stories and traditions, you’ll explore" "how the plants we find in our city have been used for healing, ceremony, and" "connection across generations. Along the way, you’ll deepen your knowledge of" "traditional plant wisdom, express your learning through creative mediums, and start to" "see the city—and yourself—differently. Together, we’ll weave our experiences into a" "youth-led public event that blends nature, culture, and creativity: ‘Moving Through" "our Senses with the Plant World.’” A stipend of up to $550 will be provided for this" "Dates: September 2025 - June 2026" "Application Deadline: June 27" "Deadline Approaching: FXB Climate Advocates Summer Program" "“The Summer 2025 cohort of the FXB Climate Advocates Program is a two-week" "intensive program that equips youth to informs, empowers, and mobilizes youth to" "implement climate solutions. title: "New: Cyber-AI Investigation Camp"
description: "“The Cyber-AI Investigation Camp will focus on increasing student interest in" "cybercrime investigation by teaching cybersecurity knowledge, safe online behavior," "and cyber forensics investigation. "Camp participants will explore the world of cyber investigation with experts in the" "field through fun, real-world learning experiences enhanced by teacher-student" "interaction. Camp activities include hands-on exercises, interactive lectures, games," "and career exploration.”" "Dates: July 8 - 10" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "https://scranton.advancementform.com/event/2025-cyber-ai-investigation-camp/register" "Deadline Approaching: Urban Arts Summer Game Academy" "“In our accelerated summer program, you will complete the entire first course of the" "program—2D Game Development—within six weeks. You will code and" "design your first video game prototype using Unity3D—an interactive media engine" "used widely within the game industry. "Inspirit AI students will explore applications, create foundational AI concepts, and" "develop AI programming skills before developing a Social Good project. title: "New: Ronald V. Dellums Memorial SMART Scholarship"
description: "“The Science, Mathematics, and Research for Transformation (SMART) Scholarship-" "for-Service Program is a combined educational and workforce development" "opportunity for science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) students" "funded by the DoD.” Scholarship includes: full tuition, $30,000 annual stipend, job in" "DoD, mentorship, summer internships.”" "Application Deadline: December 5 (Applications open August 1)" "https://www.smartscholarship.org/smart?id=kb_article&sys_id=0383c5d6db2a03006b" "b8f4b40f961956" "https://www.smartscholarship.org/smart?id=kb_article&sys_id=33b85cb7db754300b67330ca7c9619" "Study.com Student Scholarships" "“In order to push toward our goal of making education accessible, Study.com has" "designated a wide variety of academic awards and scholarships for students." "Study.com is thrilled to be awarding over $50,000 in scholarships. These academic" "awards are geared toward people with ranging backgrounds, identities, and academic" "goals. Check out our list below to apply for any scholarships you may qualify for!”" "Application Deadline: June 30" "Final Education PSA Scholarship" " “This year, we are inaugurating our first Financial Education PSA Scholarship to" "current and incoming undergraduate and graduate students. The goal is to provide" "students with an outlet to educate their fellows in an area of financial literacy that" "interests them. You will write a public service announcement (PSA) addressed to your" "peers. Choose a topic related to financial literacy and craft a persuasive and" "informative PSA according to the guidelines below. The winning submission, selected" "by our scholarship selection committee, will receive $1,500.”" "Application Deadline: September 15" "Bryan Cameron Impact Scholarships" "These undergraduate scholarships are four-year, full-tuition, impact-driven and are" "awarded annually to 10-15 exceptional high school students who have demonstrated" "excellence in leadership, community service, extracurricular activities and" "academics." "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis (until 3,000 complete applications are received)" "Bold.org Scholarship Resource" "“Bold.org is the largest independent scholarship provider in the U.S. with millions of" "college students funded. In addition to the traditional array of scholarships, they" "recently announced a wide variety of scholarships for immigrant students.”" "Application Deadlines: Various" "scholarships/" "The Ultimate Scholarship Spreadsheet Resource" "“Our spreadsheet houses an extensive array of scholarships, complete with filters to" "help students quickly identify the opportunities that best suit their needs. Updated" "weekly, it highlights the top ten scholarships of the month, ensuring you never miss" "out on lucrative funding options.”" "Links: https://www.seedsoffortune.org/post/the-ultimate-scholarship-spreadsheet-" "your-one-stop-guide-to-securing-free-money-for-college" "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12UUO-Om8HtAFJ8bE-" "aQo1ZNBSixsHLinhvCyfn94CbQ/edit?gid=0#gid=0" "Reserve Officers Training Corps (ROTC)" "The various military services offer Reserve Officers Training Corps (ROTC) full-" "tuition scholarships to graduating seniors who attend any of more than 1,000" "participating colleges. Applicants must have a 3.0 GPA and specific SAT/ACT scores." "Learn more about the Air Force’s program at:" "https://www.afrotc.com/" "RETURN TO TOP" " Resume & cover letter templates for basic student resumes may be accessed at the" "following links:" "http://jobsearch.about.com/od/resumesandcoverletters/l/blhighschool2.htm" "http://jobsearch.about.com/od/resumetemplates/a/templatehs.htm" "Working Papers: Some jobs, internships, and programs do require students 14-17" "years old to obtain working papers (official name: employment certificates). The" "necessary application form may be obtained from Mr. Myles Sebastien (who can" "explain the procedure and answer any questions) in the Stuyvesant Guidance Office" "(Room 236) between 8:00am – 3:30pm." "If you are selected for or enroll in any of the above opportunities, please inform" "Mr. Blumm ASAP at: hblumm@stuy.edu" "Whichever extra-curricular program, internship, or community service activity a" "student may participate in, they should be sure to ask their supervisor/coordinator to" "write a letter of appreciation before it concludes – it is sometimes very difficult to" "obtain this later on. And the more personal & detailed the letter, the better. A copy" "should then be submitted to your counselor." "Please feel free to contact Harvey Blumm at hblumm@stuy.edu with any questions or" "feedback on any items in this message, or with any suggestions or concerns you may" "have. And always feel free to share any information about opportunities that may" "be of interest to our parents, teachers, or students."

The" "lessons, along with short weekly ‘happiness homework’ assignments will prepare you" " to put these scientific findings into practice. title: "New: Wharton Global High School Investment Competition"
description: "“The Wharton Global High School Investment Competition is a free, experiential" "investment challenge for high school students (9th to 12th grade) and teachers." "Students work in teams of four to seven, guided by a teacher as their advisor, and have" " access to an online stock market simulator. Together, they learn about strategy-" "building, teamwork, communication, risk, diversification, company and industry" "analysis, and many other aspects of investing.”" "Application Deadline: September 12 (Open June 30)" "First Session Dates Approaching: Fordham University Finance Institute" "This is a one-week program that introduces high school students to the finance" "industry and to leading business companies & executives." The selected students admitted into the program will become" "Content Development Interns. This means they will collaborate with other lead" "student interns to create a milestone worth of in-app content for the Mapt College" " Planning mobile app. Interns will ultimately help Mapt’s product team to build a" "product people love to use.""" title: "New: The Voice of Democracy Audio-Essay Contest"
description: "The Voice of Democracy is a democratic and patriotic-themed essay contest. This" "year’s theme is “How Are You Showing Patriotism and Support for Our Country?”" "Students will draft an essay that treats the theme with imagination and human interest," "record their reading of it to a CD/flash drive, and submit it to their local VFW post." You’ll be learning from the" "best of the best — competitors on Yale Undergraduate Moot Court don’t just excel at" "moot court at a national level, but are also involved in other public speaking activities" "like debate and Mock Trial." "You will also have the chance to hear from legal professionals about their paths to law" "school and to practice — many of whom did moot court in undergrad or in law school." " Through this program, students will develop critical thinking, legal analysis, and" "public speaking skills, guided by experienced mentors and judges.”" "Dates: August 11 - 15" "Final Application Deadline: August 2" "Links: https://www.yalemootcourt.org/summer-program-2024" "https://forms.gle/VtefGD1zSuKwhmyE6" "Deadline Approaching:" "FHAA Teen Leadership Program: Youth Ambassadors" "“The Forest Hills Asian Association (FHAA), a community leader in advocacy," "cultural celebration, and civic engagement, is launching the FHAA Youth" "Ambassadors Program.
