As a youth-led initiative, FHAA trains student leaders to become the" "next generation of changemakers." "The training will focus on leadership development, team dynamics and the key" "qualities needed to be an effective community organizer. Parental consent is" "required for participants under 18.”" "Dates: July 10 to Sep 13 (Thursdays 5:30 to 7:30pm, Saturdays 2:00 to 4:00pm)" " Application Deadline: June 21" "Links: https://tinyurl.com/fhaa-teen-leadership" "https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YoJTK2eqAhpUImv8bXXw7CxoCwssajimYgURvwMg-" "0w/edit?usp=drivesdk" "Deadline Approaching:" "Gilder Lehrman Institute: David McCullough Essay Contest" "“Students are invited to submit an interpretive essay focusing on close reading and" "analysis of one primary source from American history, 1491 to 2001, in the Gilder" "Lehrman Collection of more than 87,000 historical documents, or students are invited" "to submit a research essay incorporating primary and secondary sources on a topic in" "American history from 1491 to 2001. The David McCullough Essay Prizes recognize" "fourteen outstanding high school students with prizes of up to $5,000.”" "Application Deadline: June 27" "Deadline Approaching: FXB Climate Advocates Summer Program" "“The Summer 2025 cohort of the FXB Climate Advocates Program is a two-week" "intensive program that equips youth to informs, empowers, and mobilizes youth to" "implement climate solutions. Participants will join a global network of youth climate" "advocates from 45 countries and learn from renowned experts from the FXB Center" "for Health and Human Rights at Harvard University, New York University, Project" "Drawdown, and others.”" " Dates: July 15, 16, 17, 22, 23, 24 (10 AM - 12 PM)" "Application Deadline: June 27" "Links: https://www.fxbclimateadvocates.org/" "https://www.fxbclimateadvocates.org/apply" "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeMAu002VVllHc6aeTY3mV_0714kuG" "LywJ04SI1nOg_HBThGw/viewform" "Event Approaching: AAPI-LEAD Program (Asian Americans and Pacific" "Islanders- Learn. Engage. Advocate. Dream)" "“AAPI-LEAD is a 4-day youth conference that brings together NYC’s AAPI and" "allied youth to discuss the experiences and issues most relevant to AAPI young" "people. AAPI-LEAD aims to develop AAPI youth's understanding of and relationship" "to their own identities, deepen the connections between social justice and equity in" "relation to systems and community, and equip youth with the tools to advocate for" "themselves, their families, and the wider AAPI community as a whole. Youth will also" "have the opportunity to apply to the Asian American Students Advocacy Project" "(ASAP), CACF's youth leadership program, by coming to this conference. ”" "Dates: June 27 - 30 or August 14 - 17" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" " Event Approaching: Queens Public Library Intro to Podcasting for Teens" "“Join us for a hands-on workshop where you'll dive into the world of storytelling" "through sound. We'll explore fun warm-up games, brainstorm creative ideas and" "themes, and learn the basics of recording and editing. Whether you're looking to" "amplify your voice or simply try something new, this program will help you build" "confidence and hone new creative skills in a supportive, collaborative environment." "No experience necessary!”" "Deadline Approaching: The Legal Empowerment Fellows Program at Defying" "Legal Gravity: 2025-2026" "“The Legal Empowerment Fellows Program is a paid, one-year fellowship in which" "high school students spend the academic school year obtaining a foundation in the" "law. The program is a zero-cost program- breakfast, lunch, and metro cards are" "provided.”" "Dates: Select Saturdays from September 2025 through June 2026 from 10:00 am -" "Locations: Fordham University School of Law near Columbus Circle" "Application Deadline: June 29" "https://www.defyinglegalgravity.org/apply?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email" "Program Dates Approaching: AMP Global Scholar Summer Program" "“Global Scholar equips youth leaders to be bold and visionary change makers around" "urgent global challenges. Participants learn about global issues from experts, build" "tools to engage their peers and communities, and take the next steps in launching" "purposeful careers. Global Scholars learn with and from some of the brightest young" "minds working on these issues today.”" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Deadline Approaching:" "Future Teachers Program with Young Minds in Motion – For Seniors" "“Are you a high school senior interested in becoming a teacher? The Future Teachers" "Program offers a paid, hands-on experience in early childhood and elementary" "education. Students will work alongside certified educators, attend career" "development workshops, and receive mentorship to support their journey into the" "teaching profession. To start the application process, email your resume to Niyasha" "James at niyashaj@youngmindsinmotion.com ”" "Dates: Ongoing" "Application Deadline: July 1" "Event Approaching: Create Your Personal Brand Workshops" "“Goodwill Virtual Career Center is a proactive learning program that offers free" "workshops to help you hit the ground running with your best foot forward on the path" "to success. Learn how to create and project a professional image of yourself, and" "strengthen your self-marketing and networking skills.”" "Dates: July 3, 17, 31 & more" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "111961616208?aff=ebdsoporgprofile" "Peace Ambassador Leadership Summit (PALS)" "“The Peace Ambassador Leadership Summit (PALS) is a transformative, seven-day" "immersive program that empowers high school students to become leaders, advocates," "and changemakers. Hosted across four prestigious universities—Georgetown" "University, University of Florida, University of Central Florida, and Florida" "International University—PALS combines rigorous workshops, hands-on service" "projects, and unforgettable experiences designed to prepare students for college," "careers, and life.”" "Dates: Various (1 week in summer 2025)" " Locations: Various universities" "Costs: $1,170 - $2,450" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Griptape Learning Challenge" "“The GripTape Learning Challenge provides you with financial support to pursue an" "interest or learn something you’re passionate about. In addition to funding, GripTape" "pairs you with a Champion to support you throughout your 10-week Learning" "Challenge. A Champion is a person who believes in you no matter what and is" "genuinely curious about you and your interests. And they help you think by asking" "great questions while never telling you what you should do.”" "Dates: Various (10-week challenge)" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Teen Service Corps" "“The Teen Service Corps is a 3 or 6-week service learning program with cohorts in" "Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens and Long Island. Throughout the program teens (rising" "9th through 12th graders) will learn about systemic injustice through a Jewish lens," "hone leadership skills, and volunteer in various neighborhoods to promote food and" "housing justice, and have fun!”" "Dates: July 8 - July 24 OR July 29 - August 14" " Locations: TBD" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Debate League Summer Camp" "“The Brooklyn Debate League, a nonprofit organization recently featured in the" "media, is hosting a summer camp this July in downtown Brooklyn. All rising 7th" "through 12th graders are invited to join. All levels of experience with Speech &" "Debate are welcome - whether you are brand new or a State Champion, we'll have" "coaches ready to meet you where you are. Visit our website to learn more and to sign" "Dates: July 14 – 25 (in-person) OR August 4 – 8 (online)" "$600 (virtual)" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "UChicago Parrhesia Ambassador Program" "“The one-week Parrhesia Ambassador Program aims to introduce pre-college students" "to the fundamental principles and practices that prepare students to communicate in a" "variety of contexts. Rooted in the University of Chicago’s Principles of Free" "Expression, the Parrhesia Program offers an innovative curriculum in the theory and" "practice of public discourse and deliberation." " Course assignments and exercises actively engage students in the rhetorical process" "of argument construction and presentation preparation and delivery. Selected" "participants will be tasked with serving as ambassadors and changemakers by sharing" "the principles of discourse and freedom of expression in communities.”" "Dates: July 20 - July 25" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "GenHERation Summer Intensive Programs" "“Designed to equip students with the tools to succeed in the classroom, college, and" "beyond, the GenHERation® Summer Intensive is a rigorous, dynamic, and immersive" "experience that inspires young women to achieve their personal and professional goals" "by encouraging them to think big and push the limits of what’s possible. Our summer" "intensives take place on-site at our partner schools across the country. Please click on" "the camp location to register directly with the host school.”" "Dates: July 21 - 23 or August 4 - 6" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Student Historian Internship 2025-2026 Program" " “Student Historian interns are high school students who use the resources of the New" "York Historical Society to conduct exciting research and share their scholarship" "through creative digital projects. Interns meet with professional staff to learn about" "careers in the museum, library, and history fields; work collaboratively with fellow" "students to develop their public speaking and leadership skills; and engage in hands-" "on work to deepen their understanding of American history. The theme of this year’s" "internship is “Our Composite Nation: Frederick Douglass’ America” Upon" "completion, participants receive a $700 stipend." "Dates: October 29 – June 24, 2026 (Wednesdays after school)" "Application Deadline: August 24" "TurnUp Youth Activism Remote Internship" "“Interns work in remote teams of mission-driven young people from all around the" "country to help amplify youth civic engagement and participate in activism on many" "progressive/social justice issues including climate change, racial justice, reproductive" "rights, ending gun violence, and combating voter suppression. We provide an" "experientially based program that empowers interns to become civically engaged," "responsible, and educated social justice advocates.”" "Dates: Various" " Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Links: https://turnup.us/internship" "https://docs.google.com/document/d/1M0Jvri8MUeZDtL_S__d9tY0BanJkMRoRyHl0NrA0/edit" "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1XhCTCrn8jdSN3r10ehH9DrsRtYZ_YnU6FdSJM6NVePw/viewf" "orm?edit_requested=true#responses" "Rhizome Civic Service Fellowship" "“The core purpose of the Fellowship is to improve our communities, spread big ideas," "and train leaders to increase civic participation. Civic Service Fellows are equipped to" "become more joyful, insightful, and purposeful leaders. Fellows build and run youth" "voice campaigns in the fall, build Community Empowerment Events around the ideas" "they are passionate about in the winter, and run local voter education drives in the" "spring. We’ll offer personal support and a consistent community for Fellows to lean" "on at every step of the journey!”" "Dates: Various" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "RETURN TO TOP" "Museums, Art, Photography:" " For a list of some Art, Museum, and Architecture programs, check this link:" "https://docs.google.com/document/d/14rHYFpifTya2h14E9vc22Dr4zicgTtAb/edit"

title: "New: Discover Your City with Culture Pass"
description: "“Explore local museums and other City attractions with Culture Pass, New York" "City's free discovery program for City library cardholders. If you have a library card" "from either the Brooklyn Public Library, the Queens Public Library, or the New York" "Public Library, you can reserve a Culture Pass online for any of 100+ cultural" "institutions across the five boroughs.”" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" " Event Approaching: Museum of Arts and Design (MAD) Monthly Artslab" "“Do you love to make things? Tik Tok tutorials just not cutting it? We got you. Join us" "once a month to weave, sculpt, draw, sew, print, design, dye, mix, brew, paint, carve," "embellish, and assemble with practicing artists. The Museum’s Artslab teen" "workshops connect students with an Artist-in-Residence for hands-on art-making." title: "New: Hudson River Park Science Leadership Program: Fall Term"
description: " “Selected interns will work in a team of high school peers and Hudson River Park" "staff. Interns will conduct hands-on STEM research on the Hudson River, develop a" "scientific communication and research project and present their work at the end of the" "program at HRPK's annual Release of the Fishes event. Interns will attend workshops" "led by local practitioners on professional development, science identity and the" "diversity of pathways in the STEM field. SLP interns will develop proficiency in field" "research, data collection and interpretation with the goal of strengthening" "communication and leadership skills. High School interns will receive a stipend of" "$300 which will be paid at the close of the internship.”" "Dates: September 17- November 5 (Wednesdays 3:30pm-5:30pm)" "Application Deadline:" "2q4pu5hZc/viewform" "Deadline Approaching: Rooted in the City Internship" "“You’ll get your hands in the soil, learn to ID local plants and trees (yes, even the" "ones growing through sidewalk cracks), and discover how fungi, dirt, and weeds have" "medicinal purposes. Through different cultural stories and traditions, you’ll explore" "how the plants we find in our city have been used for healing, ceremony, and" "connection across generations. Along the way, you’ll deepen your knowledge of" "traditional plant wisdom, express your learning through creative mediums, and start to" "see the city—and yourself—differently. Together, we’ll weave our experiences into a" "youth-led public event that blends nature, culture, and creativity: ‘Moving Through" " our Senses with the Plant World.’” A stipend of up to $550 will be provided for this" "Dates: September 2025 - June 2026" "Application Deadline: June 27" "Deadline Approaching: FXB Climate Advocates Summer Program" "“The Summer 2025 cohort of the FXB Climate Advocates Program is a two-week" "intensive program that equips youth to informs, empowers, and mobilizes youth to" "implement climate solutions. Participants will join a global network of youth climate" "advocates from 45 countries and learn from renowned experts from the FXB Center" "for Health and Human Rights at Harvard University, New York University, Project" "Drawdown, and others.”" "Dates: July 15, 16, 17, 22, 23, 24 (10 AM - 12 PM)" "Application Deadline: June 27" "Links: https://www.fxbclimateadvocates.org/" "https://www.fxbclimateadvocates.org/apply" "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeMAu002VVllHc6aeTY3mV_0714kuG" "LywJ04SI1nOg_HBThGw/viewform" " Program Dates Approaching:" "Student Conservation Community & Congress (Sc3) Program" "“Sc3 is a life-changing, week-long leadership experience for high school students who" "are ready to become environmental changemakers. Sc3 Fellows spend one exceptional" "week learning from faculty, world-renowned experts and each other at the U.S. Fish" "and Wildlife Service’s National Conservation Training Center (NCTC), a facility at" "the heart of our nation’s conservation leadership. Through discussion, networking, and" "hands-on experience, students explore the environmental, social, and economic" "interconnections that impact environmental justice, and natural resource" "conservation, grappling with the challenges & opportunities facing us all.”" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Program Dates Approaching: The Columbia Climate School in the Green" "Mountains Pre-College Summer Program" "“The Columbia Climate School in the Green Mountains, a 2-week campus-based" "program for high school students in Castleton, Vermont to mobilize action, drive" "impact, and effect change in response to our warming planet. Engage with experts" "from Columbia Climate School and learn about cutting-edge innovations in action." "Meet, collaborate, and build partnerships with like-minded students and tap into" "collective strengths for action.”" " Dates: June 29 – July 11" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis (Limited Spots)" "Links: https://www.climate.columbia.edu/green-mountains" "Information sessions:" "https://apply.climate.columbia.edu/portal/pre_college_info_session?id=2696f944-6f8e-4a2c-ab85-" "ad7a8f84bb21" "Summer Sports Instructional Programs" "Free summer sports instruction and play programs are open to all students. These" "include, tennis, golf, soccer, and more." "Dates: Various this summer" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Links: https://cityparksfoundation.org/play/" "https://cityparksfoundation.org/golf/?utm_source=City+Parks+Foundation&utm_campaign=a91c925d95-" "Konnectgolf_2020_Evite_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_64b30ed559-a91c925d95-" "209439202&mc_cid=a91c925d95&mc_eid=9a3f1baa3d" "RETURN TO TOP" "STEM Opportunities:" "For a general list of some STEM Opportunities, check this link:" "https://docs.google.com/document/d/1eQ6-Nx0DZhqhRTtvWVAG1PvWWyYsT3AO/edit" " For a list of helpful STEM resources, tutorials, and more, check this link:" "https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ExfdOlmFONphVMNzbgJgaY_xDbNBgfIe/edit" "For helpful information about a variety of STEM careers, check this link:" "https://usasciencefestival.org/resources/"

title: "New: Capital One Coders Program"
description: "“Coders is a free, virtual, 2-day beginner web development program designed around" "6th–8th grade curriculum content. However, the program is open to all students" "entering 6th–12th grade. This makes it a great opportunity for anyone looking to" "learn or refresh foundational web development skills. Students will be introduced to" "key web development concepts, including HTML and CSS, and will create their own" "website by the end of the program. Both AiC Community members and non-members" "may apply. Spots are limited—apply now.”" "Dates: July 15-16 or July 22-23" "Application Deadline: June 23" "Links: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd9Bv6b-KNrWnMatzQ-" "iHLdpDpWcHEf9Yv5TFNhdKS5CpOtgA/viewform" " https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-sHWXp0-SbyMQcSnlU6IxIc5W8DcIV9Y/view?usp=sharing" "Sessions Approaching: Inspirit AI Scholars Sessions – Summer Courses" "“AI Scholars Live Online is a 10-session (25-hour) program that exposes high school" "students to fundamental AI concepts and guides them to build a socially impactful" "project. This year we have exciting ChatGPT and Generative AI-focused projects, and" "special sessions that we hope will help build a relevant and unique AI passion project," "taught by our team of graduate students from Stanford, MIT, and more." "Inspirit AI students will explore applications, create foundational AI concepts, and" "develop AI programming skills before developing a Social Good project. No prior" "programming or computer science background is required, but an interest in AI is" "appreciated!”" "Dates: Various from early June – late August" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Dates Approaching: Blue Stamp Engineering (BSE) Summer Classes" "“Every student builds their own self-selected project in fields of their choice," "including robotics, coding, and electronics, and creates an engineering portfolio to" "share their work. Students attend workshops, listen to guest speakers, and learn to use" "specialized engineering tools.”" "Dates: June - August 2025 (Various Sessions)" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis (Limited Spots)" "Links: https://bluestampengineering.com/in-person-program/" "https://bluestampengineering.com/remote-program/" "https://bluestampengineering.com/apply/" "Deadline Approaching: Lucid AI Academy" "“The Lucid AI Academy is offering cohort-based AI boot camps and a 1-on-1" "mentorship program designed to help high school students develop real-world AI" "skills and build impressive portfolio projects. Students will learn from other student" "AI researchers and engineers, build advanced AI projects, gain practical skills, and" "join a community of like-minded students. There are 2 programs open: AI Innovators" "and 1-on-1 Research Mentorship.”" "Dates: June 22 – August 15 (AI Innovators) & 3-6 months (approximately) 1-on-1" "Research Mentorship" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Links: https://www.lucid-education.com/innovators#faqs" "https://www.lucid-education.com/research" "Program Dates Approaching:" "LVC Summer One-Week Actuarial Science Camp" " “Students with an interest in actuarial science, math, and finance are welcome to apply" "for either the late June or mid-July sessions. Students will work in teams and present" "their solutions to relevant problems; practicing actuaries will give real time" "presentations and work with students on mini projects.”" "Dates: June 22 – 27 OR July 6 – 11" "Application Deadline: ASAP (Rolling Basis)" "Deadline Approaching:" "DigiPen Academy Virtual in Game Design, Programming, & Music" "“DigiPen Academy's online summer courses offer four-week programs in Art &" "Animation, Game Design, Video Game Programming, and Music & Sound Design." "These courses introduce students to college-level coursework and industry-relevant" "skills. Over four weeks, students delve into the fundamentals of their chosen field," "guided by expert instructors in morning sessions focused on core concepts and hands-" "on project labs in the afternoons.”" "Dates: June 30 – July 25" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "programs/" " Cyber-AI Investigation Camp" "“The Cyber-AI Investigation Camp will focus on increasing student interest in" "cybercrime investigation by teaching cybersecurity knowledge, safe online behavior," "and cyber forensics investigation. Camp participants will engage in hands-on" "explorations of the many aspects of cybersecurity, including foundations of" "cybersecurity, cyber law, ethical hacking, AI, and digital forensics investigation" "techniques." "Camp participants will explore the world of cyber investigation with experts in the" "field through fun, real-world learning experiences enhanced by teacher-student" "interaction. Camp activities include hands-on exercises, interactive lectures, games," "and career exploration.”" "Dates: July 8 - 10" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "https://scranton.advancementform.com/event/2025-cyber-ai-investigation-camp/register" "Math Gym at the Museum of Mathematics" "“Students will spend an hour independently working on engaging and beautiful math" "problems, hand-selected by MoMath’s advisory council of math PhDs. Choose" "whichever challenges you like and explore them with the guidance and mentorship of" "an expert mathematician. If you love math and want to experience the incredible joy" " of mathematical discovery, you won’t want to miss this enjoyable monthly" "program.”" "Dates: July 16, August 13, and once a month on a Wednesdays in subsequent" "months (4 – 5 pm or 7 – 8 pm)" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Museum of Mathematics Programs & Volunteer Opportunities:" "Check the link below to access many of MoMath’s programs (some are being offered" "for free or at a reduced rate for those in need) — please visit individual event pages" "for more information:" "https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XazRjJWJ7QEbyeq4bAGDFl7sE5HVTt9gjk2Jx16szmk/edit" "RETURN TO TOP" "Medical/Life Sciences" "For a list of several Biomedical & Life Sciences opportunities, check this link:" "https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Amj354cprZPkvpnG32r9eWN0FEhMqaeG/edit" "Program Dates Approaching:" "miRcore Computational Biology Research Camps" " “This camp is for students interested in computer science, biology, and research. The" "camp will focus on the role of genomics in diseases and symptoms and guide students" "in performing computational biology research using patient RNA expression data to" "identify genes related to certain diseases." "Students will learn basic AI concepts in identifying diseases.”" "Dates: Various (June - August)" "Locations: In-person and virtual options available" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Deadline Approaching: Scientific Enrichment Summer Program at Columbia’s" "Herbert Irving Comprehensive Cancer Center" "“Columbia is offering a free, online summer enrichment program at Columbia’s" "Herbert Irving Comprehensive Cancer Center. Students who complete the program" "will get a certificate from Columbia and will learn about cancer research and" "professional development. Topics include an introduction to cancer research, panel" "discussions with researchers in the field, environmental equity initiatives in your" "community, professional development in the college personal statement and other" "college admissions advice, student-led activities, etc.”" "Dates: July 1 – 31" "Application Deadline: June 23 (or when full capacity is reached)" " https://www.cancer.columbia.edu/education/educational-opportunities/high-school-" "and-undergraduate-programs/scientific-enrichment-month" "https://cumc.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_1MI3CsfgmX7RiWG?Q_CHL=qr" "Program Dates Approaching:" "Rosetta Institute of Biomedical Research Workshops" "“The Rosetta Institute of Biomedical Research is entirely focused on creating highly" "regarded workshops for high-achieving high school students. Our instructors are PhD-" "level scientists who are actively engaged in medical research, and they expose" "students to cutting-edge molecular biology through engaging lectures, real-world labs," "and independent projects. Our in-person workshops at various universities include AI-" "enhanced bioinformatics, Molecular Neuroscience, Bioinformatics of Cancer," "Molecular Biology of Cancer, Molecular Immunology, Molecular Biology of Aging," "Astrobiology, Neurological Bioinformatics, and Biomedical Research. Our online" "workshops are separate concurrent sessions of Medicinal Chemistry, Medical" "Bioinformatics, and Introduction to Cellular and Molecular Medicine.”" "Dates: Various (June - August 2025)" "College London, OR Virtual" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis (Limited Spots)" "Links: https://www.rosettainstitute.org/" "https://www.rosettainstitute.org/biomedical-summer-camps/applyfinances/" "Deadline Approaching: International Young Researchers’ Conference Medical" "Humanities and Public Health Summer Programs" " “This program hosted by the Columbia University Vagelos College of Physician and" "Surgeons (VP&S) is a 3-week summer program that meets on Sundays from 8/3 –" "Dates: August 3 - August 21(Sundays)" "Application Deadline: July 1" "Links: https://www.the-iyrc.org/medicalhumanities.html" "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdkq2NZbbo0vWh2TbGo3frQEQFSxibmvCyXdSwxK" "XCuQTjB9g/viewform" "Margaret Tietz Rehabilitation & Nursing Center Volunteers" "“The Margaret Tietz Nursing & Rehabilitation Center in Queens offers high school" "students the opportunity to work as summer volunteers in a residential/medical setting" "this summer. There will be a variety of in-person helping opportunities, with weekday" "& weekend spots available. To learn more, contact the Center at 718-298-7840." "Dates: July 7 – August 20 (flexible scheduling available)" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdmTCnzPeLzlZDrnAXIKjqZtANAZteEQQjhO-" "KSk9b4rhfBgQ/viewform" "https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fR9utZWOT_9_osjX5eO5NnlaXfZJAddz/edit?usp=sharing&" "ouid=115396606750532126369&rtpof=true&sd=true" "Hospital Volunteer Opportunities" " Most NYC hospitals welcome high school student helpers. Age requirements and time" "commitments vary, so contact locations of interest for more specific information." "Dates: Various" "Application Deadlines: Rolling Basis" "Links: http://www.nychealthandhospitals.org/volunteering/" "http://www.nychealthandhospitals.org/hospitals/" "https://docs.google.com/document/d/15q4GlI8MdbZ-" "k8EpK2U3fRYFQK7Pcewp/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=111212941873538043271&rtpof=true&sd=tru" "RETURN TO TOP" "Theater/Writing/Music/Video:" "For a list of several Writing Opportunities, check this link:" "https://docs.google.com/document/d/12xABLyREvMsmbE4_mv7dnQ8BriPJzwlO/edit"

title: "New: Program Dates Approaching:"
description: "Columbia Scholastic Press Association Summer Journalism Workshop" "“The Columbia Scholastic Press Association (CSPA) invites print and online" "publication staff to take part in its 44th Annual Summer Journalism Workshop," "offered with both in-person and virtual options. CSPA offers a week-long, in-person" "workshop in June on the Columbia campus, as well as three distinct virtual sessions in" " July. The annual workshop is organized by CSPA and hosted by Columbia University." "Each session offers sequences focused on either reporting and writing, editorial" "leadership, and design.”" "Dates: June 22 – 27 (in-person) OR July 7 - 11, July 14 - 18, July 21 - 28 (virtual" "sessions)" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "summer-journalism-workshop" "73f45e58e8cb/summary"

cost: $999 - $2,199 (depending on choice of virtual, commuter, or residential options)"

title: "New: Youth Onstage!"
description: "“Youth Onstage! (YO!) introduces young people, ages 14 to 21, to performance," "improv, and the world of theatre, offering free training in the performing arts under" "the direction of volunteer theatre professionals. Training emphasizes ensemble" "building and offers experiential outings, workshops, and classes, all led by theatre" "professionals.”" "Dates: Summer" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Links: https://allstars.org/our-work/#programs" "https://allstars.org/youth-programs-applications/"
location: All Stars Project, 543 W 42nd Street, Manhattan"

title: " New: Suffolk University Filmmaking Summer Program"
description: "“Dive into the world of moviemaking with our dynamic community of filmmakers," "teachers, and VIP guest speakers and industry professionals. Here in downtown" "Boston—a city immortalized on the silver screen—you’ll develop your skills in" "directing, editing, screenwriting, sound design, camera work, and collaboration." "You’ll also work with industry-standard equipment and software, see what it’s like to" "be part of a creative team, and have serious fun. You don’t need prior filmmaking" "experience to enjoy this program, just a desire to maximize every moment of this" "amazing experience.”" "Dates: July 6-18" "Application Deadline: June 20" "media/filmmaking-summer-program"

title: "New: Gotham Writers' ""I'm Obsessed"" Contest"
description: "“Do you have what some people may consider a ""niche"" hobby or special interest?" "Perhaps you're REALLY into collecting 1990s-vintage wide-legged jeans, or maybe" "you know everything there is to know about handheld videogames? Or maybe it's a" "totally made-up obsession? Either way; Gotham Writers is looking for interesting" "stories about your hobbies as part of its ""I'm Obsessed Contest""—and the contest's" "winner will receive a free Gotham Writers class of their choosing!”" "Application Deadline: August 31" " Links: https://v2.writingclasses.com/contests/im-obsessed" "First Program Dates Approaching:" "The School of The New York Times: Summer Academy N.Y.C." "“Summer Academy N.Y.C. at The School of The New York Times is designed for" "curious-minded high school students interested in learning how to think critically and" "creatively about the world. Students explore a range of subjects including journalism," "business, politics and the arts alongside New York Times journalists and other" "industry thought leaders. Learn more about our two-week programs available this June" "and July in New York City.”" "Dates: Term 2: June 22 - July 4, Term 3: July 6 - 18, Term 4: July 20 - August 1" "Locations: TBA (Manhattan)" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Links: https://nytedu.com/pre-college/summer-academy/" "https://nytedu.com/faq/nyc-summer-academy/" "Event Approaching: Queens Public Library Intro to Podcasting for Teens" "“Join us for a hands-on workshop where you'll dive into the world of storytelling" "through sound. We'll explore fun warm-up games, brainstorm creative ideas and" "themes, and learn the basics of recording and editing. Whether you're looking to" "amplify your voice or simply try something new, this program will help you build" "confidence and hone new creative skills in a supportive, collaborative environment." "No experience necessary!”" "Deadline Approaching: Filmmaking at Hooks Art Media" "“Accepted applicants will learn how to use DSLR cameras and the professional sound" "and lighting equipment used on sets all around the world. Students learn camera" "operation, sound recording, use of lighting equipment, video editing software and" "produce short documentary videos on topics of relevance to themselves and their" "communities." "All participants earn minimum wage equivalent stipends for their participation. The" "program concludes with a public screening of students’ films for families and" "friends.”" "Dates: July 1 - July 31 (Mondays - Thursdays, 10AM-4PM)" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Usdan Summer Camp Programs" "“Usdan’s Classic Program provides an immersive arts experience and fosters" "friendship and shared enthusiasm among young artists in grades 2 through 12. Our" "program offers instruction by experienced educators and professional artists in five art" "disciplines—Art, Creative Writing, Dance, Music, and Theater—and three specialty" "areas—Chess, Nature & Sustainability, and Recreational Arts." " Like the musical notation for which it is named, Usdan’s Allegro Music Program is" "fun-filled and upbeat—a camp experience that expands students’ appreciation of" "music. For four or eight weeks, musicians and vocalists in our Allegro Music Program" "immerse themselves in music and nature on Usdan’s 140-acre campus.”" "Dates: Various" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Links: https://www.usdan.org/our-program/dates-and-rates" "https://www.usdan.org/summer-camp/programs/classic-program" "https://www.usdan.org/programs" "https://www.usdan.org/allegro-music-program" "The Open Stage Project Act One & Act Two Behind the Scenes Production" "“Open Stage offers two free opportunities for female & non-binary students:" "Act One is a single 90-minute interactive panel led by entertainment professionals to" "learn about behind-the-scenes careers." "Act Two is a September – May afterschool program, which includes:" "o   Field trips to set, costume, and lighting shops" "o   Monthly skill-building workshops" "o   One-on-one mentoring with film and Broadway professionals" "o   Broadway shows plus Q&As with female crew members" "o   Capstone design presentation for a new play with a CreateHER playwright" "No prior tech or backstage experience is required." "Act Two: 10th, 11th, and 12th grade female & non-binary students" " Dates: Various for Act One; Act Two - from September – May" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Links: https://www.openstageproject.org/program" "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSekhb7ok46_gk7KpCJ7Ujv3J36ChrDSlDj2JCVHzfy2u" "mTWXQ/viewform" "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeEThI4dUIspfC6c8cI4R0I00iWLzm9DSHMzN5sEc0i" "jUgpEQ/viewform" "Neighborhood Playhouse Junior Acting School" "“Modeled after the adult conservatory, the Junior School trains all its students in the" "core principles of acting, applying techniques and skills learned to various classes in" "singing, movement/dance, scene study, monologues, voice & diction, stage combat," "Shakespeare, acting for film & television, commercials, voice overs, auditioning," "improvisation and more--giving students complete actor training and the skills needed" "to be creative and competitive in their craft and in life.”" "Dates: Summer 2025" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Links: https://neighborhoodplayhouse.org/apply/playhouse-juniors/summer-program" "https://www.neighborhoodplayhouse.org/admissions" "STEM from Dance: Girls Rise Up" " “Girls Rise Up is our three-week summer program designed for girls to explore the" "exciting world of STEM. Each day is jampacked with dance to get participants" "moving and to supercharge their STEM skills. By the end of the program, participants" "will showcase what they’ve learned in a performance that merges dance and" "technology – all created by them and their fellow participants. Girls Rise Up is an" "opportunity for girls of all backgrounds to level up their confidence, unlock new" "STEM abilities, and connect with a supportive tribe of like-minded creatives and" "technologists.”" "Dates: July 14 – August 1 (9AM - 3PM, Monday - Friday)" "Locations: NYU (6 MetroTech Center, Brooklyn, NY ) or Barnard College (3009" "Broadway, Manhattan)" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Theater Development Fund’s Graduation Gift" "“TDF is offering free TDF Memberships to all 2025 graduating seniors from New" "York City's public and charter high schools. TDF Members can purchase deeply" "discounted tickets online for Broadway, Off-Broadway, Off-Off Broadway, music," "opera and dance performances up to 70% off. Tickets range from $11 to $60." "Graduation Gift TDF Members also receive access to exclusive special offers. On" "Wednesday, May 7, TDF hosted a celebration for Grad Gift members at the TKTS" "Booth and the red steps in Times Square. More than 2,000 high school seniors saw" "Broadway's Hell's Kitchen and SIX for FREE.”" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "programs/tdf-s-graduation-gift/" "IRT Theater Summer Theater Program" "This innovative off-Broadway theater company welcomes students (no experience" "necessary) to join “A Westside Experiment,” their teen theater program. Participants" "will develop skills to create original devised theater in collaboration with a working" "theater company in residence at IRT." "Dates: August 11 – 23" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "Breakthrough Junior Challenge Video Contest" "“You’ve grasped an important scientific theory, concept or principle. Now can you" "share your insight? An inventive video can get across complex material that would" "take pages of text to communicate. To take part in the Breakthrough Junior Challenge," "create a short video (two minute maximum) to explain a big idea in one of these" "fields: physics, mathematics, or life sciences. The top prize is a $250,000" "scholarship!”" "Application Deadline: September 15" " Links: https://breakthroughjuniorchallenge.org/challenge" "https://breakthroughjuniorchallenge.org/enter" "RETURN TO TOP" "Contests & Competitions:"

title: "New: Wharton Global High School Investment Competition"
description: "“The Wharton Global High School Investment Competition is a free, experiential" "investment challenge for high school students (9th to 12th grade) and teachers." "Students work in teams of four to seven, guided by a teacher as their advisor, and have" "access to an online stock market simulator. Together, they learn about strategy-" "building, teamwork, communication, risk, diversification, company and industry" "analysis, and many other aspects of investing.”" "Application Deadline: September 12 (Open June 30)"

title: "New: Congressional App Challenge 2025"
description: "“The annual Congressional App Challenge is an opportunity for young people to" "cultivate their skills in these STEM disciplines and to begin thinking about their" "futures in the many American industries that will rely on emerging technologies and" "STEM innovation in the coming years. Students may use any programming language" "they choose, including C, C++, JavaScript, Python, Ruby, “block code,” etc." "Dates: Various" "Application Deadline: October 30" "Links: https://www.congressionalappchallenge.us/students/student-registration/" "https://webportalapp.com/sp/login/congressional_app_challenge_2025"

title: "New: The Voice of Democracy Audio-Essay Contest"
description: "The Voice of Democracy is a democratic and patriotic-themed essay contest. This" "year’s theme is “How Are You Showing Patriotism and Support for Our Country?”" "Students will draft an essay that treats the theme with imagination and human interest," "record their reading of it to a CD/flash drive, and submit it to their local VFW post." "Application Deadline: October 31" "Links: https://www.vfw.org/community/youth-and-education/youth-scholarships" "https://vfworghqagarhxahbybyd9.z01.azurefd.net/-/media/VFWSite/Files/Community/Youth-and-" "Education/Voice-of-Democracy-Entry-Form-Fillable.pdf?la=en&v=1&d=20250425T161111Z" "Deadline Approaching:" "Gilder Lehrman Institute: David McCullough Essay Contest" "“Students are invited to submit an interpretive essay focusing on close reading and" "analysis of one primary source from American history, 1491 to 2001, in the Gilder" "Lehrman Collection of more than 87,000 historical documents, or students are invited" "to submit a research essay incorporating primary and secondary sources on a topic in" "American history from 1491 to 2001. The David McCullough Essay Prizes recognize" "fourteen outstanding high school students with prizes of up to $5,000.”" "Application Deadline: June 27" "Breakthrough Junior Challenge Video Contest" "“You’ve grasped an important scientific theory, concept or principle. Now can you" "share your insight? An inventive video can get across complex material that would" "take pages of text to communicate. To take part in the Breakthrough Junior Challenge," "create a short video (2:00 – two minute max) to explain a big idea in one of these" "fields: physics, mathematics, or life sciences. The top prize is a $250,000" "scholarship!”" "Application Deadline: September 15" "Links: https://breakthroughjuniorchallenge.org/challenge" "https://breakthroughjuniorchallenge.org/enter" "World Series of Innovation Entrepreneurial Challenge" "“Explore the innovation challenges offered this season and see what grabs your" "interest. Set a timer and come up with as many ideas as you can in short order. Go" "wild with the rapid ideation then look over your list and choose your best idea. Once" "you've signed up to compete you can access the online entry form by clicking ""Get" "Started"" and get to work building your entry. Just remember to submit your idea by" "December 15”" "Application Deadline: December 15 (Begins September 9)" "compete/?_gl=1*l7q94r*_ga*NDU0MjMyOTMzLjE3MTgyMDY1ODg.*_ga_DGM46Z4NVN*MT" "cxODI1NDg5NC4zLjEuMTcxODI1NTg5NS4wLjAuMA" "TurnUp Civic Tech Challenge" "“The TurnUp Civic Tech Challenge welcomes folks under age 26 to share their idea" "for a civic technology project that will promote youth voter registration, turnout, or" "activism. Enter for the chance to win up to $25,000 and TurnUp's support to help" "bring your vision to life. We welcome projects in any phase of execution, whether it's" "an idea or already in the works.”" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSc3TVLKsgwC1Lf2BaPtQB5EAtU8THNGrc-" "Bj3MPbcTxoIjaPw/viewform" "Congressional Art Competition" "Teen artists may enter the Congressional Art Competition, for a chance to have their" "artwork on display at the U.S. Capitol for one year. Entries must be submitted through" "your local congressperson. Contact your representative to confirm your district’s" "participation and for guidance – consult this link to find your representative:" "https://www.house.gov/representatives/find-yourrepresentative" "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis" " RETURN TO TOP" "Opportunity Lists and Resources:" "Click on the link below for a list of helpful lists and guides to a wide variety of" "programs and other opportunities:" "https://docs.google.com/document/d/1507ozc-" "AbhTI6DlTRBTQWMpRHToNMRki/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=111212941873538043271&rtpof=true&sd=true" "RETURN TO TOP" "Scholarships:" "Deadline Approaching: Study.com Student Scholarships" "“In order to push toward our goal of making education accessible, Study.com has" "designated a wide variety of academic awards and scholarships for students." "Study.com is thrilled to be awarding over $50,000 in scholarships. These academic" "awards are geared toward people with ranging backgrounds, identities, and academic" "goals. Check out our list below to apply for any scholarships you may qualify for!”" "Application Deadline: June 30" "Financial Education PSA Scholarship" " “This year, we are inaugurating our first Financial Education PSA Scholarship to" "current and incoming undergraduate and graduate students. The goal is to provide" "students with an outlet to educate their fellows in an area of financial literacy that" "interests them. You will write a public service announcement (PSA) addressed to your" "peers. Choose a topic related to financial literacy and craft a persuasive and" "informative PSA according to the guidelines below. The winning submission, selected" "by our scholarship selection committee, will receive $1,500.”" "Application Deadline: September 15" "Bryan Cameron Impact Scholarships" "These undergraduate scholarships are four-year, full-tuition, impact-driven and are" "awarded annually to 10-15 exceptional high school students who have demonstrated" "excellence in leadership, community service, extracurricular activities and" "academics." "Application Deadline: Rolling Basis (until 3,000 complete applications are received)" "Ronald V. Dellums Memorial SMART Scholarship" "“The Science, Mathematics, and Research for Transformation (SMART) Scholarship-" "for-Service Program is a combined educational and workforce development" "opportunity for science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) students" "funded by the DoD.” Scholarship includes: full tuition, $30,000 annual stipend, job in" "DoD, mentorship, summer internships.”" " Application Deadline: December 5 (Applications open August 1)" "https://www.smartscholarship.org/smart?id=kb_article&sys_id=0383c5d6db2a03006b" "b8f4b40f961956" "https://www.smartscholarship.org/smart?id=kb_article&sys_id=33b85cb7db754300b67330ca7c9619" "Bold.org Scholarship Resource" "“Bold.org is the largest independent scholarship provider in the U.S. with millions of" "college students funded. In addition to the traditional array of scholarships, they" "recently announced a wide variety of scholarships for immigrant students.”" "Application Deadlines: Various" "scholarships/" "The Ultimate Scholarship Spreadsheet Resource" "“Our spreadsheet houses an extensive array of scholarships, complete with filters to" "help students quickly identify the opportunities that best suit their needs. Updated" "weekly, it highlights the top ten scholarships of the month, ensuring you never miss" "out on lucrative funding options.”" "Links: https://www.seedsoffortune.org/post/the-ultimate-scholarship-spreadsheet-" "your-one-stop-guide-to-securing-free-money-for-college" "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12UUO-Om8HtAFJ8bE-" "aQo1ZNBSixsHLinhvCyfn94CbQ/edit?gid=0#gid=0" "Reserve Officers Training Corps (ROTC)" " The various military services offer Reserve Officers Training Corps (ROTC) full-" "tuition scholarships to graduating seniors who attend any of more than 1,000" "participating colleges. Applicants must have a 3.0 GPA and specific SAT/ACT scores." "Learn more about the Air Force’s program at:" "https://www.afrotc.com/" "RETURN TO TOP" "Resume & cover letter templates for basic student resumes may be accessed at the" "following links:" "http://jobsearch.about.com/od/resumesandcoverletters/l/blhighschool2.htm" "http://jobsearch.about.com/od/resumetemplates/a/templatehs.htm" "Working Papers: Some jobs, internships, and programs do require students 14-17" "years old to obtain working papers (official name: employment certificates). The" "necessary application form may be obtained from Mr. Myles Sebastien (who can" "explain the procedure and answer any questions) in the Stuyvesant Guidance Office" "(Room 236) between 8:00am – 3:30pm." "If you are selected for or enroll in any of the above opportunities, please inform" "Mr. Blumm ASAP at: hblumm@stuy.edu" " Whichever extra-curricular program, internship, or community service activity a" "student may participate in, they should be sure to ask their supervisor/coordinator to" "write a letter of appreciation before it concludes – it is sometimes very difficult to" "obtain this later on. And the more personal & detailed the letter, the better. A copy" "should then be submitted to your counselor." "Please feel free to contact Harvey Blumm at hblumm@stuy.edu with any questions or" "feedback on any items in this message, or with any suggestions or concerns you may" "have. And always feel free to share any information about opportunities that may" "be of interest to our parents, teachers, or students."
